CVE-2009-0228.title: Windows Print Spooler Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Read Arbitrary Files
CVE-2009-0228.body: Three vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Print Spooler. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A local user can read arbitrary files on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted RPC request to the print spooler to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-0228]. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.A local user can cause the print spooler to include files with a separator to view arbitrary files on the target system [CVE-2009-0229].A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted DLL path to cause the print spooler to load an arbitrary dynamic link library (DLL) [CVE-2009-0230].Jun Mao of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported one of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0228.extra: A remote user or remote authenticated can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local user can read arbitrary files on the target system.

CVE-2009-0229.title: Windows Print Spooler Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Read Arbitrary Files
CVE-2009-0229.body: Three vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Print Spooler. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A local user can read arbitrary files on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted RPC request to the print spooler to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-0228]. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.A local user can cause the print spooler to include files with a separator to view arbitrary files on the target system [CVE-2009-0229].A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted DLL path to cause the print spooler to load an arbitrary dynamic link library (DLL) [CVE-2009-0230].Jun Mao of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported one of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0229.extra: A remote user or remote authenticated can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local user can read arbitrary files on the target system.

CVE-2009-0230.title: Windows Print Spooler Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Read Arbitrary Files
CVE-2009-0230.body: Three vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Print Spooler. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A local user can read arbitrary files on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted RPC request to the print spooler to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-0228]. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.A local user can cause the print spooler to include files with a separator to view arbitrary files on the target system [CVE-2009-0229].A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted DLL path to cause the print spooler to load an arbitrary dynamic link library (DLL) [CVE-2009-0230].Jun Mao of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported one of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0230.extra: A remote user or remote authenticated can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local user can read arbitrary files on the target system.

CVE-2009-0231.title: Windows Embedded OpenType (EOT) Font Engine Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-0231.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in the Windows Embedded OpenType (EOT) Font Engine. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a web page or document containing a specially crafted EOT font that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.VeriSign iDefense Labs and Thomas Garnier reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0231.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0232.title: Windows Embedded OpenType (EOT) Font Engine Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-0232.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in the Windows Embedded OpenType (EOT) Font Engine. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a web page or document containing a specially crafted EOT font that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.VeriSign iDefense Labs and Thomas Garnier reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0232.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0233.title: Microsoft DNS Server Bugs Let Remote Users Spoof the DNS Service
CVE-2009-0233.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft DNS Server. A remote user can spoof the DNS.The Windows DNS server does not reuse cached responses when receiving specifically crafted queries. As a result, subsequent transaction IDs used by the DNS server can be more readily predicted [CVE-2009-0233].The Windows DNS server does not properly cache specially crafted DNS responses. As a result, subsequent transaction IDs used by the DNS server can be more readily predicted [CVE-2009-0234].A remote user may be able to exploit these vulnerabilities to insert arbitrary addresses into the DNS cache.Kevin Day and Dave Dagon reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0233.extra: A remote user can spoof the DNS service.

CVE-2009-0234.title: Microsoft DNS Server Bugs Let Remote Users Spoof the DNS Service
CVE-2009-0234.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft DNS Server. A remote user can spoof the DNS.The Windows DNS server does not reuse cached responses when receiving specifically crafted queries. As a result, subsequent transaction IDs used by the DNS server can be more readily predicted [CVE-2009-0233].The Windows DNS server does not properly cache specially crafted DNS responses. As a result, subsequent transaction IDs used by the DNS server can be more readily predicted [CVE-2009-0234].A remote user may be able to exploit these vulnerabilities to insert arbitrary addresses into the DNS cache.Kevin Day and Dave Dagon reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0234.extra: A remote user can spoof the DNS service.

CVE-2009-0235.title: Microsoft WordPad and Office Text Converter Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-0235.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Office in WordPad and Office Text Converters. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted Word 6 file can trigger memory corruption [CVE-2009-0087]. A researcher with Fortinet s FortiGuard Global Security Research Team reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted WordPerfect 6.x file can trigger a stack overflow [CVE-2009-0088]. A researcher with VeriSign iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted Word document can trigger stack overflow [CVE-2009-0235]. Sean Larsson and Jun Mao of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-0235.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0237.title: Microsoft ISA Server Input Validation Flaw in 'cookieauth.dll' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-0237.body: A vulnerability was reported in in Microsoft ISA Server and Microsoft Forefront Threat Management Gateway. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The HTML forms authentication component (cookieauth.dll) does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Microsoft Internet Security and Acceleration Server software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Microsoft Internet Security and Acceleration Server 2000 SP2 is not affected.The New York State Chief Information Officer / Office for Technology reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-0237.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Microsoft Internet Security and Acceleration Server software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-0238.title: Microsoft Excel Invalid Object Access Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-0238.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Excel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will access an invalid object and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor indicates that this vulnerability is being actively exploited in limited situations.The Open XML File Format Converter for Mac is not affected.
CVE-2009-0238.extra: A remote user can create an Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0239.title: Windows Search Lets Remote Users Execute Scripting Code to Obtain Information
CVE-2009-0239.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Search. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information from the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when processed by Windows Search on the target user's system, will execute arbitrary scripting code. This can be exploited to access information on the target user's system.The target user must perform a search that returns the file as the first result for script execution to occur.Yair Amit of IBM Rational Application Security reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-0239.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information from the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0307.title: BlackBerry Enterprise Server Input Validation Flaw in MDS Connection Service Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-0307.body: A vulnerability was reported in BlackBerry Enterprise Server. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The MDS Connection Service does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the BlackBerry Enterprise Server software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Ken Millar of Sensient Technologies Corporation, Michael Thumann of ERNW, and Martin O'Neal and Stephen de Vries of Corsaire independently reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-0307.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the BlackBerry Enterprise Server software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-0311.title: EMC AutoStart Backbone Service Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-0311.body: A vulnerability was reported in EMC AutoStart. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the Backbone service (ftbackbone.exe) to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with System privileges.The vendor was notified on August 26, 2008.Manuel Santamarina Suarez reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.
CVE-2009-0311.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with System privileges.

CVE-2009-0344.title: Sun Fire Embedded Lights Out Manager Lets Remote Users Gain Access
CVE-2009-0344.body: A vulnerability was reported in Embedded Lights Out Manager on Sun Fire. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on or gain access to the target system.A remote user can login with the privileges of the Embedded Lights Out Manager (ELOM).A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the Service Processor.Tomas Kopal reported one of the vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0344.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system or gain access to the target system.

CVE-2009-0345.title: Sun Fire Embedded Lights Out Manager Lets Remote Users Gain Access
CVE-2009-0345.body: A vulnerability was reported in Embedded Lights Out Manager on Sun Fire. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on or gain access to the target system.A remote user can login with the privileges of the Embedded Lights Out Manager (ELOM).A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the Service Processor.Tomas Kopal reported one of the vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0345.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system or gain access to the target system.

CVE-2009-0352.title: Mozilla Firefox Bugs in JavaScript Engine and Layout Engine May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-0352.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger flaws in the layout engine or javascript engine and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Mozilla Thunderbird and Mozilla Seamonkey are also affected.Jesse Ruderman, Georgi Guninski, Martijn Wargers, and Gary Kwong reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0352.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0353.title: Mozilla Firefox Bugs in JavaScript Engine and Layout Engine May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-0353.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger flaws in the layout engine or javascript engine and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Mozilla Thunderbird and Mozilla Seamonkey are also affected.Jesse Ruderman, Georgi Guninski, Martijn Wargers, and Gary Kwong reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0353.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0354.title: Mozilla Firefox Chrome XBL Method Permits Cross-Domain Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-0354.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can conduct cross-domain scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by a target user, invokes a chrome XBL method in conjunction with the window.eval method to cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will run in the security context of an arbitrary site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Firefox version 2.x is not affected.moz_bug_r_a4 reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-0354.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with an arbitrary site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-0355.title: Mozilla Firefox Closed Tab Restoration Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Files
CVE-2009-0355.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can obtain files from the target user's system.A remote user can cause a form input control's type to be modified when a closed tab is restored. This can be exploited to change an input text value to the path of a known local file so that when the tab is closed and then re-opened, the file will be disclosed to the remote user.moz_bug_r_a4 reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-0355.extra: A remote user can obtain files from the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0357.title: Mozilla Firefox HTTPOnly Enforcement Flaw Lets Users Access Cookies
CVE-2009-0357.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user may be able to obtain cookies in certain cases.A remote user can create HTML that invokes the XMLHttpRequest.getResponseHeader and XMLHttpRequest.getAllResponseHeaders APIs to bypass the HTTPOnly flag and access cookies on the target user's browser.SeaMonkey is also affected.Wladimir Palant reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-0357.extra: A remote user may be able to obtain cookies in certain cases.

CVE-2009-0358.title: Mozilla Firefox Does Not Properly Enforce Cache-Control Directives
CVE-2009-0358.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A local user on a shared system may be able to access potentially sensitive information.The browser does not properly enforce certain HTTP directives, including Cache-Control: no-store and Cache-Control: no-cache for HTTPS pages. A local user on a shared system may be able to access potentially sensitive information that was not intended to be cached.Paul Nel reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-0358.extra: A local user on a shared system may be able to access potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2009-0360.title: pam-krb5 Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2009-0360.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in pam-krb5. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.pam-krb5 does not use the correct API for initializing the Kerberos libraries in a set user id (setuid) environment when linked with MIT Kerberos [CVE-2009-0360]. As a result, a local user can bypass authentication in setuid applications that use PAM for authentication. The software is not affected when linked with Heimdal Kerberos.A local user can cause pam-krb5 to overwrite and chown the file specified by the KRB5CCNAME environment variable when an application uses pam_setcred with PAM_REINITIALIZE_CREDS or PAM_REFRESH_CREDS to refresh existing user credentials [CVE-2009-0361].The Russ Allbery version of pam-krb5 is affected.
CVE-2009-0360.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can overwrite and gain ownership of files on the target system.

CVE-2009-0361.title: pam-krb5 Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2009-0361.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in pam-krb5. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.pam-krb5 does not use the correct API for initializing the Kerberos libraries in a set user id (setuid) environment when linked with MIT Kerberos [CVE-2009-0360]. As a result, a local user can bypass authentication in setuid applications that use PAM for authentication. The software is not affected when linked with Heimdal Kerberos.A local user can cause pam-krb5 to overwrite and chown the file specified by the KRB5CCNAME environment variable when an application uses pam_setcred with PAM_REINITIALIZE_CREDS or PAM_REFRESH_CREDS to refresh existing user credentials [CVE-2009-0361].The Russ Allbery version of pam-krb5 is affected.
CVE-2009-0361.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can overwrite and gain ownership of files on the target system.

CVE-2009-0365.title: GNOME NetworkManager Lets Local Users Obtain Passwords
CVE-2009-0365.body: A vulnerability was reported in GNOME NetworkManager. A local user can obtain passwords.A local user can invoke the GetSecrets method due to a flaw in the access control configuration to obtain network connection passwords and pre-shared keys.
CVE-2009-0365.extra: A local user can obtain obtain network connection passwords and pre-shared keys.

CVE-2009-0365.title: (Red Hat Issues Fix) GNOME NetworkManager Lets Local Users Obtain Passwords
CVE-2009-0365.body: A vulnerability was reported in GNOME NetworkManager. A local user can obtain passwords.A local user can invoke the GetSecrets method due to a flaw in the access control configuration to obtain network connection passwords and pre-shared keys.
CVE-2009-0365.extra: A local user can obtain obtain network connection passwords and pre-shared keys.

CVE-2009-0365.title: (Red Hat Issues Fix) GNOME NetworkManager Lets Local Users Obtain Passwords
CVE-2009-0365.body: A vulnerability was reported in GNOME NetworkManager. A local user can obtain passwords.A local user can invoke the GetSecrets method due to a flaw in the access control configuration to obtain network connection passwords and pre-shared keys.
CVE-2009-0365.extra: A local user can obtain obtain network connection passwords and pre-shared keys.

CVE-2009-0391.title: IBM WebSphere Discloses Files to Remote Users
CVE-2009-0391.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM WebSphere Application Server on z/OS. A remote user can view files on the target system.A remote user can view arbitrary files on target system. No details were provided.IBM has assigned APAR PK72036 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-0391.extra: A remote user can view files on the target system.

CVE-2009-0396.title: Sony Ericsson Phone WAP Push Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-0396.body: A vulnerability was reported in some Sony Ericsson phones. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted WAP Push packet via SMS or IP to cause the target device to reboot. In some cases, the target device may hang, requiring battery removal to return to normal operations.The following devices are affected:W910iW660iK618iK610iZ610iK810iK660iW880iK530iMobile Security Lab reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.mseclab.com/index.php?page_id=123
CVE-2009-0396.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to crash or hang.

CVE-2009-0412.title: Interspire Shopping Cart Authentication Flaw in 'class.auth.php' Lets Remote Users Gain Administrative Privileges
CVE-2009-0412.body: A vulnerability was reported in Interspire Shopping Cart. A remote user can obtain administrative access on the target application.A remote user can exploit a flaw in the ProcessLogin() function in 'class.auth.php' to cause the system to set an authentication cookie on the user's client that will allow the user to gain access to the administrative control panel without authenticating.The vendor was notified on January 07, 2009.Truong Van Tri and Blue Moon Consulting reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-0412.extra: A remote user can gain administrative privileges on the target application.

CVE-2009-0414.title: Tor Heap Corruption Flaw May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-0414.body: A vulnerability was reported in Tor. A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a heap corruption error on some platforms and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. [Editor's note: The vendor did not confirm code execution. Third party reports have implied code execution.]Ilja van Sprundel reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-0414.extra: A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2009-0418.title: HP-UX IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Protocol Spoofing Bug Lets Remote Users Modify Routing Data in Certain Cases
CVE-2009-0418.body: A vulnerability was reported in the HP-UX IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Protocol. A remote user can modify routing data for a target router in certain cases.A remote user on a physical network of an IPv6 router can spoof Neighbor Discovery messages to update routing information for a target router on a different physical network adjacent to the IPv6 router. The remote user can exploit this to deny service or access network traffic from the target router.David Miles reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-0418.extra: A remote user can modify routing data for a target router in certain cases to deny service or redirect and access network traffic.

CVE-2009-0449.title: Kaspersky Anti-Virus Buffer Overflow in 'Klim5.sys' Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2009-0449.body: A vulnerability was reported in Kaspersky Anti-Virus. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in 'Klim5.sys' to execute arbitrary code on the target system with System privileges.Kaspersky Anti-Virus for Windows Workstations version 6.0 is also affected.Some demonstration exploit code is available at:http://kartoffel.reversemode.com/downloads.phpThe original advisory is available at:http://www.wintercore.com/advisories/advisory_W020209.htmlRuben Santamarta of Wintercore reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-0449.extra: A local user can obtain System privileges on the target system.

CVE-2009-0478.title: Squid HTTP Request Processing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-0478.body: A vulnerability was reported in Squid. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted requests to cause unspecified denial of service conditions.Joshua Morin, Mikko Varpiola, and Jukka Taimisto from the CROSS project at Codenomicon Ltd. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-0478.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2009-0480.title: Solaris Bug in IP Implementation Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-0480.body: A vulnerability was reported in Solaris. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can exploit a flaw in the Solaris IP(7p) implementation to open a large number of sockets, denying service to 32-bit applications. In some cases, this may adversely affect the system.
CVE-2009-0480.extra: A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2009-0509.title: Adobe Acrobat and Adobe Reader Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-0509.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Acrobat and Adobe Reader. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An anonymous researcher (via TippingPoint), Jun Mao and Ryan Smith of iDefense Labs, Haifei Li of Fortinet's FortiGuard Global Security Research Team, the Apple Product Security Team, Matthew Watchinski of Sourcefire VRT, Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research, Mark Dowd of the IBM Internet Security Systems X-Force, Will Dormann of CERT, and Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Security reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0509.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0510.title: Adobe Acrobat and Adobe Reader Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-0510.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Acrobat and Adobe Reader. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An anonymous researcher (via TippingPoint), Jun Mao and Ryan Smith of iDefense Labs, Haifei Li of Fortinet's FortiGuard Global Security Research Team, the Apple Product Security Team, Matthew Watchinski of Sourcefire VRT, Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research, Mark Dowd of the IBM Internet Security Systems X-Force, Will Dormann of CERT, and Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Security reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0510.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0511.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Acrobat and Adobe Reader. CVE-2009-0511.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0512.title: Adobe Acrobat and Adobe Reader Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-0512.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Acrobat and Adobe Reader. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An anonymous researcher (via TippingPoint), Jun Mao and Ryan Smith of iDefense Labs, Haifei Li of Fortinet's FortiGuard Global Security Research Team, the Apple Product Security Team, Matthew Watchinski of Sourcefire VRT, Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research, Mark Dowd of the IBM Internet Security Systems X-Force, Will Dormann of CERT, and Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Security reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0512.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0520.title: Adobe Flash Player Invalid Object Reference Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-0520.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Flash file that, when loaded by the target user, will reference a deleted object and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on August 25, 2008.Javier Vicente Vallejo reported this vulnerability via iDefense.[Editor's note: The vendor describes this vulnerability as a buffer overflow.]
CVE-2009-0520.extra: A remote user can create Flash content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0523.title: Adobe RoboHelp Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-0523.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe RoboHelp. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the RoboHelp software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Files generated by RoboHelp are affected [CVE-2009-0524].The RoboHelp Server Help Errors log is affected [CVE-2009-0523].Greg Patton of PropertyInfo Corporation and Robert Fly of SalesForce.com reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0523.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the RoboHelp software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-0524.title: Adobe RoboHelp Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-0524.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe RoboHelp. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the RoboHelp software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Files generated by RoboHelp are affected [CVE-2009-0524].The RoboHelp Server Help Errors log is affected [CVE-2009-0523].Greg Patton of PropertyInfo Corporation and Robert Fly of SalesForce.com reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0524.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the RoboHelp software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-0536.title: IBM AIX 'at' Command Lets Local Users View Arbitrary Files
CVE-2009-0536.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX. A local user can view arbitrary files on the target system.A local user can exploit a flaw in the set user id (setuid) root '/usr/bin/at' command to view arbitrary files on the target system.iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-0536.extra: A local user can view arbitrary files on the target system.

CVE-2009-0537.title: OpenBSD libc fts Function Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-0537.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenBSD. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can make a call to one of the "fts" functions with a specially crafted (and deep) directory path to trigger a memory error and cause the system to crash.The vulnerability resides in 'libc/gen/fts.c'.The following applications can be used to trigger a crash:durmchmod -Rchgrp -RMaksymilian Arciemowicz of SecurityReason.com reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/60
CVE-2009-0537.extra: A local user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2009-0541.title: Magento Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-0541.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Magento. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The administrator logon, administrator password reminder, and update downloader features do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Magento software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor was notified on January 21, 2009.Loukas Kalenderidis from SOS Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-0541.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Magento software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-0549.title: Microsoft Excel Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-0549.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Excel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create an Excel file with a specially crafted record object that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Bing Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Global Security Research Team, Carsten H. Eiram of Secunia, TELUS Security Labs Vulnerability Research Team, Sean Larsson and Joshua Drake of VeriSign iDefense Labs, and Tipping Point reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0549.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0551.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-0551.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer (IE). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.IE version 8 is not affected.Specially crafted HTML code when transitioning between web pages can trigger a memory corruption error [CVE-2009-0551]. Michal Zalewski of Google reported this vulnerability.HTML code that invokes a deleted object or an incorrectly initialized object can trigger a memory corruption error [CVE-2009-0552, CVE-2009-0553, CVE-2009-0554]. Ivan Fratric of iSIGHT Partners Labs, Skylined of Google, and ADLab of VenusTech reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0551.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0552.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer (IE). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.IE version 8 is not affected.Specially crafted HTML code when transitioning between web pages can trigger a memory corruption error [CVE-2009-0551]. Michal Zalewski of Google reported this vulnerability.HTML code that invokes a deleted object or an incorrectly initialized object can trigger a memory corruption error [CVE-2009-0552, CVE-2009-0553, CVE-2009-0554]. Ivan Fratric of iSIGHT Partners Labs, Skylined of Google, and ADLab of VenusTech reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0552.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0554.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0556.title: Microsoft Office PowerPoint Invalid Object Access Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-0556.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted PowerPoint file that, when loaded by the target user, will access an invalid memory object and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The following versions are not affected:Microsoft Office PowerPoint 2007Microsoft Office PowerPoint 2007 Service Pack 1Microsoft Office PowerPoint Viewer 2003Microsoft Office PowerPoint Viewer 2007Microsoft Office Compatibility Pack for Word, Excel, and PowerPoint 2007 File FormatsMicrosoft Office Compatibility Pack for Word, Excel, and PowerPoint 2007 File Formats Service Pack 1Microsoft Office 2008 for MacOpen XML File Format Converter for Mac
CVE-2009-0556.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-0557.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Excel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create an Excel file with a specially crafted record object that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Bing Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Global Security Research Team, Carsten H. Eiram of Secunia, TELUS Security Labs Vulnerability Research Team, Sean Larsson and Joshua Drake of VeriSign iDefense Labs, and Tipping Point reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-0557.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
