A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive data.A remote user that can specify that a target web site use a third-party style sheet can conduct cross-site scripting attacks via XBL bindings [CVE-2009-1308]. Cefn Hoile reported this vulnerability. Thunderbird may be affected if JavaScript is enabled (not the default setting).A remote user can create a specially crafted MozSearch plugin using a 'javascript:' URI in the SearchForm value [CVE-2009-1310]. On execution of an empty search, the javascript URI will be executed in the context of the current page. Prateek Saxena reported this vulnerability.When the inner frame of a web page is saved, POST data associated with the outer page may be sent to the URL of the inner frame [CVE-2009-1311]. Paolo Amadini reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1311.extra: A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive data.

CVE-2009-1313.title: Mozilla Firefox Bug in nsTextFrame::ClearTextRun() May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1313.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in nsTextFrame::ClearTextRun() and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The flaw was introduced in version 3.0.9.Marc Gueury and Daniel Veditz reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1313.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, may execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1313.title: (Red Hat Issues Fix) Mozilla Firefox Bug in nsTextFrame::ClearTextRun() May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1313.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in nsTextFrame::ClearTextRun() and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The flaw was introduced in version 3.0.9.Marc Gueury and Daniel Veditz reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1313.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, may execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1334.title: IBM Tivoli Continuous Data Protection for Files Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-1334.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Tivoli Continuous Data Protection for Files. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The 'FilepathLogin.html' page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'reason' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the IBM Tivoli Continuous Data Protection for Files software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]:9003/login/FilepathLogin.html?reason=<script>alert(0)</script>Insight Technologies reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.insight-tech.org/index.php?p=IBM-Tivoli-Continuous-Data-Protection-for-Files-version-3-1-4-0---XSS
CVE-2009-1334.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the IBM Tivoli Continuous Data Protection for Files software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-1336.title: Linux Kernel NFS Memory Initialization Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-1336.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux Kernel. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can create a specially crafted filename to trigger an initialization error in the nfs_server struct and cause the target system to crash.The vulnerability resides in 'fs/nfs/client.c'.
CVE-2009-1336.extra: A local user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2009-1337.title: Linux Kernel Bug in exit_notify() Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2009-1337.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux Kernel. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can invoke an application that modifies the exit_signal field and then launches a set user id (setuid) application via an exec system call to be able to send an arbitrary signal to a process. This can be exploited to gain elevated privileges.The vulnerability resides in the exit_notify() function in 'kernel/exit.c'.
CVE-2009-1337.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2009-1339.title: TWiki Image Tag Processing Bug Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2009-1339.body: A vulnerability was reported in TWiki. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote authenticated user (including an anonymous TWikiGuest user) can create a specially crafted image tag that, when viewed by the target user, will update pages on the target system with the privileges of the target user. The remote authenticated user can exploit this to gain administrative privileges on the target application.Steve 'Ashcrow' Milner reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1339.extra: A remote authenticated user (including an anonymous TWikiGuest user) can cause pages to be updated with the privileges of the target user.

CVE-2009-1345.title: cpCommerce Input Validation Flaw in 'id_document' Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2009-1345.body: A vulnerability was reported in cpCommerce. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.The 'id_document' parameter in 'document.php' is affected.NoGe reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/8455
CVE-2009-1345.extra: A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2009-1350.title: Novell Client NetIdentity Agent Pointer Dereference Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1350.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell Client. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data via a valid IPC$ RPC connection to trigger a pointer dereference in 'xtagent.exe' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Messages sent via the XTIERRPCPIPE named pipe are affected.The vendor was notified on October 15, 2008.Ruben Santamarta reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.
CVE-2009-1350.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2009-1355.title: IBM AIX Buffer Overflow in muxatmd Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2009-1355.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in the muxatmd command to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the target system.The vendor was notified on December 16, 2008.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2009-1355.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2009-1357.title: Sun Java System Delegated Administrator Bug Lets Remote Users Conduct HTTP Response Splitting Attacks
CVE-2009-1357.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sun Java System Delegated Administrator. A remote user can conduct HTTP response splitting attacks.A remote user can submit a specially crafted URL to cause the target server to return a split response. A remote user can exploit this to spoof content on the target server, attempt to poison any intermediate web caches, or conduct cross-site scripting attacks.CORE Security Technologies reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1357.extra: A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause arbitrary content to be displayed.A remote user may be able to poison any intermediate web caches with arbitrary content.

CVE-2009-1371.title: Clam AntiVirus UPack File and URL Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-1371.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Clam AntiVirus. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted UPack-encoded file to trigger a flaw in the CLI_ISCONTAINED macro and potentially cause the target service to crash.The vulnerability resides in 'libclamav/others.h'.Martin Olsen reported this vulnerability.A remote user can supply a specially crafted URL to trigger a flaw in cli_url_canon() and cause the target service to crash. This bug may allow stack modification, but code execution was not confirmed in the report.The vulnerability resides in 'libclamav/phishcheck.c'Nigel Horne reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1371.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2009-1372.title: Clam AntiVirus UPack File and URL Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-1372.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Clam AntiVirus. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted UPack-encoded file to trigger a flaw in the CLI_ISCONTAINED macro and potentially cause the target service to crash.The vulnerability resides in 'libclamav/others.h'.Martin Olsen reported this vulnerability.A remote user can supply a specially crafted URL to trigger a flaw in cli_url_canon() and cause the target service to crash. This bug may allow stack modification, but code execution was not confirmed in the report.The vulnerability resides in 'libclamav/phishcheck.c'Nigel Horne reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1372.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2009-1377.title: OpenSSL DTLS Processing Bugs Let Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-1377.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A user can cause denial of service conditions.A user can send specially crafted DTLS records with a future epoch to consume excessive memory on the target system.A user can send specially crafted DTLS messages to trigger a memory leak and consume excessive memory on the target system.A user can send DTLS data with a specially crafted certificate to cause freed memory to be used by the dtls1_retrieve_buffered_fragment() function in 'ssl/d1_both.c'. OpenSSL 1.0.0 Beta 2 is affected.Daniel Mentz reported the above listed vulnerabilities.A remote user can send a DTLS ChangeCipherSpec packet prior to a ClientHello packet to trigger a null pointer dereference in 'ssl/s3_pkt.c' and cause the target daemon to crash.A remote user can send an out-of-sequence DTLS handshake message to trigger a null pointer dereference in the dtls1_retrieve_buffered_fragment() function in 'ssl/d1_both.c' and cause the target daemon to crash.
CVE-2009-1377.extra: A user can consume excessive memory on the target system.A user can cause an affected application to crash.

OpenSSL 1.0.0 Beta 2 is affected.Daniel Mentz reported the above listed vulnerabilities.A remote user can send a DTLS ChangeCipherSpec packet prior to a ClientHello packet to trigger a null pointer dereference in 'ssl/s3_pkt.c' and cause the target daemon to crash.A remote user can send an out-of-sequence DTLS handshake message to trigger a null pointer dereference in the dtls1_retrieve_buffered_fragment() function in 'ssl/d1_both.c' and cause the target daemon to crash.
CVE-2009-1378.extra: A user can consume excessive memory on the target system.A user can cause an affected application to crash.

CVE-2009-1380.title: JBoss Enterprise Application Platform Input Validation Holes in the JMX Console and Web Console Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-1380.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in JBoss Enterprise Application Platform. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The JMX Console [CVE-2009-1380] and the Web Console [CVE-2009-2405] do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the JBoss software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Swatej Kumar reported the Web Console vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1380.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the JBoss software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-1389.title: Citrix XenServer Packet Processing Flaw in Realtek 8169 Driver Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1389.body: A vulnerability was reported in Citrix XenServer. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted (long) packet to cause the target system to crash or execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2009-1389.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system or cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2009-1392.title: Mozilla Firefox Bugs in JavaScript Engine and Browser Engine May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1392.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger memory corruption errors and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Mozilla SeaMonkey is also affected.Bob Clary, Jesse Ruderman, Alexander Sack, Bret McMillan, Tomeo Vizoso, Matt McCutchen, Martijn Wargers, Adam Hauner, and Igor Bukanov reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-1392.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1392.title: Mozilla Thunderbird Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1392.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Thunderbird. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can send specially crafted e-mail that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-1392, CVE-2009-1832, CVE-2009-1833, CVE-2009-1838]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. Thunderbird is affected if JavaScript is enabled [not the default configuration].A remote user can send specially crafted e-mail that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary scripting code with chrome privileges on the target user's system [CVE-2009-1841]. The system is not vulnerable in the default configuration. The system may be vulnerable if the user has installed an add-on which adds a similarly implemented feature and then enables JavaScript in mail messages.
CVE-2009-1392.extra: A remote user can create an e-mail message that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1394.title: Motorola Timbuktu PlughNTCommand Named Pipe Stack Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1394.body: A vulnerability was reported in Motorola Timbuktu. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data via the PlughNTCommand named pipe to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with SYSTEM privileges.The vendor was notified on July 9, 2008.Ruben Santamarta of reversemode.com reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1394.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with SYSTEM privileges.

CVE-2009-1416.title: GnuTLS DSA Key Generation Creates RSA Keys Instead of DSA Keys
CVE-2009-1416.body: A vulnerability was reported in GnuTLS. The system generates potentially weak keys.When generating DSA keys, the system generates RSA keys instead. The system will also sign data using these incorrect keys.The vulnerability resides in 'lib/gnutls_pk.c'.Simon Josefsson reported this vulnerability.

CVE-2009-1417.title: GnuTLS Command Line Interface Does Not Properly Validate X.509 Certificates
CVE-2009-1417.body: A vulnerability was reported in GnuTLS. The system may validate invalid certificates.The gnutls-cli component does not check the activation and expiration dates of X.509 certificates.Romain Francoise reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1417.extra: The system may validate invalid certificates.

CVE-2009-1418.title: HP System Management Homepage Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-1418.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP System Management Homepage. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the HP System Management Homepage software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Masashi Shiraishi reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1418.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the HP System Management Homepage software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-1428.title: Symantec Anti Virus Input Validation Flaw in Log Viewer Permits Remote HTML Injection Attacks
CVE-2009-1428.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Anti Virus. A remote user can conduct HTML injection attacks.The Log Viewer (ccLgView.exe) does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can send an e-mail containing specially crafted arbitrary JavaScript code. When the target user views the event log via the 'View Logs - Email Filtering' option from the Statistics option of the Symantec Log Viewer, the arbitrary scripting code will be executed on the target user's system. The code may be able to access data on the viewer or take actions on the viewer acting as the target user.Mark Litchfield from Next Generation Security Software reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1428.extra: A remote user may be able to access data on the viewer take actions on the viewer acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-1428.title: Norton Internet Security Input Validation Flaw in Log Viewer Permits Remote HTML Injection Attacks
CVE-2009-1428.body: A vulnerability was reported in Norton Internet Security. A remote user can conduct HTML injection attacks.The Log Viewer (ccLgView.exe) does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can send an e-mail containing specially crafted arbitrary JavaScript code. When the target user views the event log via the 'View Logs - Email Filtering' option from the Statistics option of the Symantec Log Viewer, the arbitrary scripting code will be executed on the target user's system. The code may be able to access data on the viewer or take actions on the viewer acting as the target user.Mark Litchfield from Next Generation Security Software reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1428.extra: A remote user may be able to access data on the viewer take actions on the viewer acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-1428.title: Symantec Endpoint Protection Input Validation Flaw in Log Viewer Permits Remote HTML Injection Attacks
CVE-2009-1428.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Endpoint Protection. A remote user can conduct HTML injection attacks.The Log Viewer (ccLgView.exe) does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can send an e-mail containing specially crafted arbitrary JavaScript code. When the target user views the event log via the 'View Logs - Email Filtering' option from the Statistics option of the Symantec Log Viewer, the arbitrary scripting code will be executed on the target user's system. The code may be able to access data on the viewer or take actions on the viewer acting as the target user.Mark Litchfield from Next Generation Security Software reported this vulnerability.

CVE-2009-1429.title: Symantec Anti Virus Corporate Edition Bugs in Alert Management System 2 Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1429.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Symantec Anti Virus Corporate Edition in the Alert Management System 2 component. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the Intel LANDesk Common Base Agent (CBA) on TCP port 12174 to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-1429]. The code will run with System privileges.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the Intel Alert Originator Service (IAO.EXE) to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-1430]. The code will run with System privileges.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the Intel Alert Originator Service (IAO.EXE) to trigger a separate stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-1430]. The code will run with System privileges.A remote user can create specially crafted code on a fileshare or WebDav server and then send the UNC path of the file to the Intel File Transfer service (XFR.EXE) on the target system to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-1431]. The code will run with System privileges.Sebastian Apelt and Tenable Network Securutiy reported some of these vulnerabilities via Zero Day Initiative; an anonymous researcher reported one vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2009-1429.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with System level privileges.

CVE-2009-1429.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code with System level privileges on the target system.

CVE-2009-1432.title: Symantec Client Security Bug in Reporting Server Lets Remote Users Display Arbitrary Messages
CVE-2009-1432.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Client Security in the Symantec Reporting Server component. A remote user can cause arbitrary HTML to be displayed.A remote user can exploit a URL handling error in the Reporting Server login screen to display a message of their choice on the Reporting Server login screen.Dave Lewis of LiquidMatrix reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1432.extra: A remote user can cause arbitrary messages to be displayed on the login screen.

CVE-2009-1432.title: Symantec Anti Virus Corporate Edition Bug in Reporting Server Lets Remote Users Display Arbitrary Messages
CVE-2009-1432.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Anti Virus Corporate Edition in the Symantec Reporting Server component. A remote user can cause arbitrary messages to be displayed.A remote user can exploit a URL handling error in the Reporting Server login screen to display a message of their choice on the Reporting Server login screen.Dave Lewis of LiquidMatrix reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1432.extra: A remote user can cause arbitrary messages to be displayed on the login screen.

CVE-2009-1432.title: Symantec Endpoint Protection Bug in Reporting Server Lets Remote Users Display Arbitrary Messages
CVE-2009-1432.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Endpoint Protection in the Symantec Reporting Server component. A remote user can cause arbitrary messages to be displayed.A remote user can exploit a URL handling error in the Reporting Server login screen to display a message of their choice on the Reporting Server login screen.Dave Lewis of LiquidMatrix reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1432.extra: A remote user can cause arbitrary messages to be displayed on the login screen.

CVE-2009-1435.title: Trend Micro OfficeScan Client Bug in Scanning Long Pathnames Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-1435.body: A vulnerability was reported in Trend Micro OfficeScan. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can create a specially crafted directory structure that, when scanned, will cause the target application to crash.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://es.geocities.com/jplopezy/officescan.zipJuan Pablo Lopez Yacubian reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1435.extra: A local user can cause the target application to crash.

CVE-2009-1436.title: FreeBSD libc db(3) May Leak Potentially Sensitive Information into db Files
CVE-2009-1436.body: A vulnerability was reported in libc on FreeBSD. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.The FreeBSD libc db(3) interface code used to create Berkeley database files does not properly initialized some data structures. The utility may cause potentially sensitive information to be unintentionally written to Berkeley DB 1.85 database files when the files are created. A local user may be able to obtain the potentially sensitive information (e.g., login credentials) from those files.Jaakko Heinonen and Xin LI reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1436.extra: A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information from db files.

CVE-2009-1441.title: Google Chrome Input Validation Flaw in InitSkBitmapFromData() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1441.body: A vulnerability was reported in Google Chrome. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in InitSkBitmapFromData() and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.cpu at chromium.org reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1441.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1442.title: Google Chrome Integer Overflow in Skia 2D Graphics Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code Within the Sandboxed Browser Tab
CVE-2009-1442.body: A vulnerability was reported in Google Chrome. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed within the sandboxed browser tab on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted image or canvas file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code within the Google Chrome sandbox.skylined at chromium.org reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1442.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code within the sandboxed browser tab on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1464.title: A-A-S Application Access Server CSRF Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
CVE-2009-1464.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in A-A-S Application Access Server. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks to execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A remote user can use a default password to gain administrative access. A local user can obtain passwords.The 'job' parameter of 'index.aas' does not properly validate requests [CVE-2009-1464]. A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary commands on the target application.The system uses a common default password ("wildbat") for the admin account [CVE-2009-1465]. If the password is not changed, a remote user can gain administrative access to the target application.The system stores passwords in plain text form in the 'aas.ini' file [CVE-2009-1466]. A local user can obtain the passwords.Felipe Aragon of the Syhunt Security Research Team reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.syhunt.com/advisories/?id=aas-multiple
CVE-2009-1464.extra: A remote user can cause arbitrary commands to be executed on the target application.A remote user can gain administrative access to the target application when the admin password has not been changed from its default value.A local user can obtain passwords.

CVE-2009-1466.title: A-A-S Application Access Server CSRF Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
CVE-2009-1466.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in A-A-S Application Access Server. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks to execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A remote user can use a default password to gain administrative access. A local user can obtain passwords.The 'job' parameter of 'index.aas' does not properly validate requests [CVE-2009-1464]. A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary commands on the target application.The system uses a common default password ("wildbat") for the admin account [CVE-2009-1465]. If the password is not changed, a remote user can gain administrative access to the target application.The system stores passwords in plain text form in the 'aas.ini' file [CVE-2009-1466]. A local user can obtain the passwords.Felipe Aragon of the Syhunt Security Research Team reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.syhunt.com/advisories/?id=aas-multiple
CVE-2009-1466.extra: A remote user can cause arbitrary commands to be executed on the target application.A remote user can gain administrative access to the target application when the admin password has not been changed from its default value.A local user can obtain passwords.

CVE-2009-1467.title: IceWarp WebMail Server Input Validation Flaw in 'Email View' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-1467.body: A vulnerability was reported in IceWarp WebMail Server in the Email View function. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The Email View function does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can send a specially crafted e-mail message that, when viewed by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the WebMail software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor was notified on April 1, 2009.The original advisory is available at:http://www.redteam-pentesting.de/advisories/rt-sa-2009-001RedTeam Pentesting GmbH reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1467.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the WebMail software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-1467.title: IceWarp WebMail Server Input Validation Hole in RSS Feed Reader Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-1467.body: A vulnerability was reported in IceWarp WebMail Server in the RSS feed reader. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The RSS feed reader does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can place specially crafted JavaScript in an RSS feed that, when viewed by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the WebMail software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor was notified on April 1, 2009.The original advisory is available at: http://www.redteam-pentesting.de/advisories/rt-sa-2009-002RedTeam Pentesting GmbH reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1467.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the WebMail software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-1468.title: IceWarp WebMail Server Input Validation Flaw in Groupware Component Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2009-1468.body: A vulnerability was reported in IceWarp WebMail Server in the groupware component. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The groupware component does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can submit HTML with specially crafted parameter values to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.The vendor was notified on April 1, 2009.RedTeam Pentesting GmbH reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.redteam-pentesting.de/advisories/rt-sa-2009-003
CVE-2009-1468.extra: A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2009-1469.title: IceWarp WebMail Server Password Reminder Lets Remote Users Inject Mail Header Values
CVE-2009-1469.body: A vulnerability was reported in IceWarp WebMail Server. A remote user may be able to obtain username and password information in certain cases.The "Forgot Password" function that sends e-mail messages generates the mail messages on the client and sends the messages from the IceWarp WebMail Server. A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will inject additional headers into the mail message (that will be sent by the server). A remote user can exploit this to obtain username and password information.The vendor was notified on April 1, 2009.The original advisory is available at:http://www.redteam-pentesting.de/advisories/rt-sa-2009-004RedTeam Pentesting GmbH reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1469.extra: A remote user can obtain username and password information.

CVE-2009-1476.title: IP Filter ippool Buffer Overflow in 'lib/load_http.c' May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2009-1476.body: A vulnerability was reported in IP Filter. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in 'lib/load_http.c' to potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges.The original advisory is available at:http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/62Maksymilian Arciemowicz reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1476.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2009-1492.title: Adobe Reader Bugs in getAnnots() and spell.customDictionaryOpen() Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1492.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Reader. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted PDF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The getAnnots() function is affected [CVE-2009-1492].The spell.customDictionaryOpen() is affected on UNIX-based systems [CVE-2009-1493].All versions of Adobe Reader and Acrobat are affected.The original advisories and exploit code is available at:http://packetstormsecurity.org/0904-exploits/getannots.txthttp://packetstormsecurity.org/0904-exploits/spell.txtArr1val reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-1492.extra: A remote user can create a PDF file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1493.title: Adobe Reader Bugs in getAnnots() and spell.customDictionaryOpen() Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1493.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Reader. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted PDF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The getAnnots() function is affected [CVE-2009-1492].The spell.customDictionaryOpen() is affected on UNIX-based systems [CVE-2009-1493].All versions of Adobe Reader and Acrobat are affected.The original advisories and exploit code is available at:http://packetstormsecurity.org/0904-exploits/getannots.txthttp://packetstormsecurity.org/0904-exploits/spell.txtArr1val reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-1493.extra: A remote user can create a PDF file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1523.title: Oracle Complex Event Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Access Data
CVE-2009-1523.body: A vulnerability was reported in Oracle Complex Event Processing. A remote user can access data on the target system.Applications deployed directly to Jetty are affected.The following researchers reported these and other Oracle vulnerabilities:Anonymous of TippingPoint (3com); Esteban Martinez Fayo of Application Security, Inc.; Kowsik Guruswamy of Mu Security; Joxean Koret; Alexander Kornbrust of Red Database Security; David Litchfield of NGS Software; Oleg P. of HSC Security Portal; Alexandr Polyakov of Digital Security; noderat ratty; and Dennis Yurichev.
CVE-2009-1523.extra: A remote user can access data on the target system.

CVE-2009-1528.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1528.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer (IE). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Specially crafted method calls to dynamic HTML objects can trigger memory corruption [CVE-2009-1141].Specially crafted HTML that accesses an object that has not been properly initialized or has been deleted can trigger code execution [CVE-2009-1528, CVE-2009-1529, CVE-2009-1530, CVE-2009-1531, CVE-2009-1532].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass Internet Explorer domain restrictions and access content from another domain (including the local computer zone) [CVE-2009-1140].Jorge Luis Alvarez Medina of Core Security Technologies, Haifei Li of Fortinet s FortiGuard Global Security Research Team, TippingPoint, Peter Vreugdenhil (via TippingPoint), Wushi (via TippingPoint), and Nils (via TippingPoint) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-1528.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will access information on other domains or on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1529.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1529.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer (IE). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Specially crafted method calls to dynamic HTML objects can trigger memory corruption [CVE-2009-1141].Specially crafted HTML that accesses an object that has not been properly initialized or has been deleted can trigger code execution [CVE-2009-1528, CVE-2009-1529, CVE-2009-1530, CVE-2009-1531, CVE-2009-1532].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass Internet Explorer domain restrictions and access content from another domain (including the local computer zone) [CVE-2009-1140].Jorge Luis Alvarez Medina of Core Security Technologies, Haifei Li of Fortinet s FortiGuard Global Security Research Team, TippingPoint, Peter Vreugdenhil (via TippingPoint), Wushi (via TippingPoint), and Nils (via TippingPoint) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-1529.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will access information on other domains or on the target user's system.

The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Specially crafted method calls to dynamic HTML objects can trigger memory corruption [CVE-2009-1141].Specially crafted HTML that accesses an object that has not been properly initialized or has been deleted can trigger code execution [CVE-2009-1528, CVE-2009-1529, CVE-2009-1530, CVE-2009-1531, CVE-2009-1532].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass Internet Explorer domain restrictions and access content from another domain (including the local computer zone) [CVE-2009-1140].Jorge Luis Alvarez Medina of Core Security Technologies, Haifei Li of Fortinet s FortiGuard Global Security Research Team, TippingPoint, Peter Vreugdenhil (via TippingPoint), Wushi (via TippingPoint), and Nils (via TippingPoint) reported these vulnerabilities.

The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Specially crafted method calls to dynamic HTML objects can trigger memory corruption [CVE-2009-1141].Specially crafted HTML that accesses an object that has not been properly initialized or has been deleted can trigger code execution [CVE-2009-1528, CVE-2009-1529, CVE-2009-1530, CVE-2009-1531, CVE-2009-1532].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass Internet Explorer domain restrictions and access content from another domain (including the local computer zone) [CVE-2009-1140].Jorge Luis Alvarez Medina of Core Security Technologies, Haifei Li of Fortinet s FortiGuard Global Security Research Team, TippingPoint, Peter Vreugdenhil (via TippingPoint), Wushi (via TippingPoint), and Nils (via TippingPoint) reported these vulnerabilities.

A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Specially crafted method calls to dynamic HTML objects can trigger memory corruption [CVE-2009-1141].Specially crafted HTML that accesses an object that has not been properly initialized or has been deleted can trigger code execution [CVE-2009-1528, CVE-2009-1529, CVE-2009-1530, CVE-2009-1531, CVE-2009-1532].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass Internet Explorer domain restrictions and access content from another domain (including the local computer zone) [CVE-2009-1140].Jorge Luis Alvarez Medina of Core Security Technologies, Haifei Li of Fortinet s FortiGuard Global Security Research Team, TippingPoint, Peter Vreugdenhil (via TippingPoint), Wushi (via TippingPoint), and Nils (via TippingPoint) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-1532.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will access information on other domains or on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1533.title: Microsoft Works Document Converter Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1533.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Works. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.wps' file that, when converted by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the Works for Windows document converters and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Shaun Colley of NGS Software and Yuji Ukai of Fourteenforty Research Institute, Inc. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1533.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1533.title: Microsoft Office Works Document Converter Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1533.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.wps' file that, when converted by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the Works for Windows document converters and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Shaun Colley of NGS Software and Yuji Ukai of Fourteenforty Research Institute, Inc. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1533.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1534.title: Microsoft Office Web Components Buffer Overflows in ActiveX Control Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1534.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow or memory allocation error in the Office Web Components ActiveX control and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Microsoft Internet Security and Acceleration Server 2004 SP3 and 2006 SP1, Microsoft BizTalk Server 2002, Microsoft Visual Studio .NET 2003 SP1, and Microsoft Office Small Business Accounting 2006 are also affected.Peter Vreugdenhil of Zero Day Initiative and Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs each reported some of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-1534.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1536.title: Microsoft ASP.NET Request Scheduling Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-1536.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft ASP.NET. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP requests to the target web service to trigger a flaw in request scheduling and cause the target service to become non-responsive until the associated application pool is restarted.Web pages that use ASP.NET in the same application pool will be unavailable.Alexander Pfandt of Digitaria reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1536.extra: A remote user can cause the target web service to become unresponsive.

CVE-2009-1542.title: Microsoft Virtual PC/Server Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges Within a Guest Operating System
CVE-2009-1542.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Virtual PC/Server. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target guest operating system.The software does not properly validate privilege levels when executing specific instructions in the Virtual Machine Monitor. A local user in the guest operating system can execute commands with kernel level privileges (within the guest).The host operating system is not affected.Julien Tinnes and Tavis Ormandy of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1542.extra: A local user in a guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges within that guest operating system.

CVE-2009-1545.title: Windows Media File Processing Flaw in Handling AVI Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1545.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Media file processing. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted AVI file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Specially crafted headers can trigger code execution [CVE-2009-1545].A specially crafted file can trigger an integer overflow [CVE-2009-1546].Windows Media Player is not affected.Vinay Anantharaman of Adobe Systems, Inc. reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-1545.extra: A remote user can create an AVI file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1546.title: Windows Media File Processing Flaw in Handling AVI Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1546.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Media file processing. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted AVI file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Specially crafted headers can trigger code execution [CVE-2009-1545].A specially crafted file can trigger an integer overflow [CVE-2009-1546].Windows Media Player is not affected.Vinay Anantharaman of Adobe Systems, Inc. reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-1546.extra: A remote user can create an AVI file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1564.title: VMware Heap Overflows in VMnc Codec Let Remote Users Cause Arbitrary Code to Be Executed
CVE-2009-1564.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted media file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow in the VMware media codec and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The codec is part of VMware Workstation, VMware Player, and VMware ACE, and is also available as a stand alone package.iDefense, Sebastien Renaud of VUPEN Vulnerability Research Team, and Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-1564.extra: A remote user can create a media file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1565.title: VMware Heap Overflows in VMnc Codec Let Remote Users Cause Arbitrary Code to Be Executed
CVE-2009-1565.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted media file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow in the VMware media codec and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The codec is part of VMware Workstation, VMware Player, and VMware ACE, and is also available as a stand alone package.iDefense, Sebastien Renaud of VUPEN Vulnerability Research Team, and Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-1565.extra: A remote user can create a media file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1586.title: Grabit Stack Overflow in Parsing NZB Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1586.body: A vulnerability was reported in Grabit. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create an NZB file with specially crafted DTD references that, when parsed by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Niels Teusink reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1586.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1635.title: Novell GroupWise WebAccess Input Validation Flaw in Login Page Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-1635.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell GroupWise WebAccess. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The login page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the GroupWise software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The 'GWAP.version', 'User.Theme.index', and 'User.lang' fields are affected.The vendor was notified on January 6, 2009.Scott White of Secure State reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1635.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the GroupWise software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-1636.title: GroupWise Internet Agent Buffer Overflows in SMTP Service Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1636.body: A vulnerability was reported in GroupWise Internet Agent. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted e-mail address via SMTP or specially crafted SMTP requests to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the SYSTEM privileges.The vendor was notified on February 18, 2009.The original advisory is available at:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/1393Nicolas JOLY of VUPEN Security reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1636.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with SYSTEM privileges.

CVE-2009-1668.title: TYPSoft FTP ABOR Command Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-1668.body: A vulnerability was reported in TYPSoft FTP Server. A authenticated remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user can send a series of specially crafted ABOR requests to cause the target service to become unavailable for the duration of the requests.The original advisory is available at:http://milw0rm.com/exploits/8650Jonathan Salwan reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1668.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to become unavailable.

CVE-2009-1684.title: Apple Safari Bugs Permit Cross-Domain Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-1684.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can conduct cross-domain scripting attacks.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser in the context of another domain or site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.An event handler can execute a script in the security context of the next web page that is loaded in its window or frame [CVE-2009-1684]. Michal Zalewski of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.A remote user can overwrite the 'document.implementation' property of an embedded or parent document served from a different security zone [CVE-2009-1685]. Dean McNamee of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.WebKit does not properly determine the security context associated with scripts [CVE-2009-1688]. Adam Barth of UC Berkeley and Collin Jackson of Stanford University reported this vulnerability.A form submitted to 'about:blank' can synchronously replace the target document's security context, allowing currently-executing scripts to run in the new security context [CVE-2009-1689]. Adam Barth of UC Berkeley and Collin Jackson of Stanford University reported this vulnerability.A remote user can modify standard JavaScript prototypes of web sites served from a different domain [CVE-2009-1691].The contents of a frame can be accessed by an HTML document after a page transition has occurred [CVE-2009-1695]. Feng Qian of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.A web site can bypass the same-origin policy by issuing an XMLHttpRequest that does not contain an HTTP Host header [CVE-2009-1697]. Per von Zweigbergk reported this vulnerability.The handling of Location and History objects may permit cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2009-1702]. Adam Barth and Joel Weinberger of UC Berkeley reported this vulnerability.A flaw in Web Inspector in the processing of HTML attributes allows a page being inspected to run injected script with elevated privileges and can read the target user's file system [CVE-2009-1714]. Pengsu Cheng of Wuhan University reported this vulnerability.A flaw in Web Inspector allows a page being inspected to run injected script with elevated privileges and can read the target user's file system [CVE-2009-1715]. Collin Jackson of Stanford University and Adam Barth of UC Berkeley reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1684.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with a target site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.An event handler can execute a script in the security context of the next web page that is loaded in its window or frame [CVE-2009-1684]. Michal Zalewski of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.A remote user can overwrite the 'document.implementation' property of an embedded or parent document served from a different security zone [CVE-2009-1685]. Feng Qian of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.A web site can bypass the same-origin policy by issuing an XMLHttpRequest that does not contain an HTTP Host header [CVE-2009-1697]. Per von Zweigbergk reported this vulnerability.The handling of Location and History objects may permit cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2009-1702]. Adam Barth and Joel Weinberger of UC Berkeley reported this vulnerability.A flaw in Web Inspector in the processing of HTML attributes allows a page being inspected to run injected script with elevated privileges and can read the target user's file system [CVE-2009-1714]. Pengsu Cheng of Wuhan University reported this vulnerability.A flaw in Web Inspector allows a page being inspected to run injected script with elevated privileges and can read the target user's file system [CVE-2009-1715]. Collin Jackson of Stanford University and Adam Barth of UC Berkeley reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1685.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with a target site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-1686.title: Apple Safari Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1686.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Specially crafted JavaScript can trigger a flaw in JavaScript exception handling [CVE-2009-1686]. Jesse Ruderman of Mozilla Corporation reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted JavaScript can trigger a memory corruption error in WebKit's JavaScript garbage collector [CVE-2009-1687]. SkyLined of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted HTML can trigger a memory corruption error in WebKit's processing of certain DOM event handlers [CVE-2009-1690]. SkyLined of Google Inc. and wushi & ling of team509 (via iDefense) reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted CSS code can trigger an uninitialized pointer bug in the processing of the CSS 'attr' function [CVE-2009-1698]. Thierry Zoller (via TippingPoint) and Robert Swiecki of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted HTML can trigger a use-after-free bug in the processing of the JavaScript DOM [CVE-2009-1701]. wushi & ling of team509 (via TippingPoint) reported this vulnerability.A bug in the open-help-anchor URL handler may let remote users access local files or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2009-1708]. Billy Rios and Microsoft Vulnerability Research reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted SVN animation elements can trigger a use-after-free bug [CVE-2009-1709]. An anonymous researcher (via TippingPoint) reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted HTML can trigger an uninitialized memory access bug in the processing of Attr DOM objects [CVE-2009-1711]. Feng Qian of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.A remote web site can load local applets, which may let remote users access potentially sensitive information or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2009-1712].
CVE-2009-1686.extra: A remote user can create HTML or other content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1688.title: Apple Safari Bugs Permit Cross-Domain Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-1688.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can conduct cross-domain scripting attacks.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser in the context of another domain or site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.An event handler can execute a script in the security context of the next web page that is loaded in its window or frame [CVE-2009-1684]. Michal Zalewski of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.A remote user can overwrite the 'document.implementation' property of an embedded or parent document served from a different security zone [CVE-2009-1685]. Dean McNamee of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.WebKit does not properly determine the security context associated with scripts [CVE-2009-1688]. Adam Barth of UC Berkeley and Collin Jackson of Stanford University reported this vulnerability.A form submitted to 'about:blank' can synchronously replace the target document's security context, allowing currently-executing scripts to run in the new security context [CVE-2009-1689]. Adam Barth of UC Berkeley and Collin Jackson of Stanford University reported this vulnerability.A remote user can modify standard JavaScript prototypes of web sites served from a different domain [CVE-2009-1691].The contents of a frame can be accessed by an HTML document after a page transition has occurred [CVE-2009-1695]. Feng Qian of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.A web site can bypass the same-origin policy by issuing an XMLHttpRequest that does not contain an HTTP Host header [CVE-2009-1697]. Per von Zweigbergk reported this vulnerability.The handling of Location and History objects may permit cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2009-1702]. Adam Barth and Joel Weinberger of UC Berkeley reported this vulnerability.A flaw in Web Inspector in the processing of HTML attributes allows a page being inspected to run injected script with elevated privileges and can read the target user's file system [CVE-2009-1714]. Pengsu Cheng of Wuhan University reported this vulnerability.A flaw in Web Inspector allows a page being inspected to run injected script with elevated privileges and can read the target user's file system [CVE-2009-1715]. Collin Jackson of Stanford University and Adam Barth of UC Berkeley reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1688.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with a target site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-1704.title: Apple Safari Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary JavaScript in the Local Context
CVE-2009-1704.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can cause arbitrary JavaScript to be executed on the target user's system.Downloaded image files may be incorrectly identified by the browser as HTML. A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary JavaScript on the target user's system without warning. The JavaScript will run in the local context.Sergio 'shadown' Alvarez of Recurity Labs GmbH reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1704.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary JavaScript on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1712.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Specially crafted JavaScript can trigger a flaw in JavaScript exception handling [CVE-2009-1686]. Jesse Ruderman of Mozilla Corporation reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted JavaScript can trigger a memory corruption error in WebKit's JavaScript garbage collector [CVE-2009-1687]. SkyLined of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted HTML can trigger a memory corruption error in WebKit's processing of certain DOM event handlers [CVE-2009-1690]. SkyLined of Google Inc. and wushi & ling of team509 (via iDefense) reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted CSS code can trigger an uninitialized pointer bug in the processing of the CSS 'attr' function [CVE-2009-1698]. Thierry Zoller (via TippingPoint) and Robert Swiecki of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted HTML can trigger a use-after-free bug in the processing of the JavaScript DOM [CVE-2009-1701]. wushi & ling of team509 (via TippingPoint) reported this vulnerability.A bug in the open-help-anchor URL handler may let remote users access local files or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2009-1708]. Billy Rios and Microsoft Vulnerability Research reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted SVN animation elements can trigger a use-after-free bug [CVE-2009-1709]. An anonymous researcher (via TippingPoint) reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted HTML can trigger an uninitialized memory access bug in the processing of Attr DOM objects [CVE-2009-1711]. Feng Qian of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.A remote web site can load local applets, which may let remote users access potentially sensitive information or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2009-1712].
CVE-2009-1712.extra: A remote user can create HTML or other content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1714.title: Apple Safari Bugs Permit Cross-Domain Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-1714.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can conduct cross-domain scripting attacks.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser in the context of another domain or site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.An event handler can execute a script in the security context of the next web page that is loaded in its window or frame [CVE-2009-1684]. Michal Zalewski of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.A remote user can overwrite the 'document.implementation' property of an embedded or parent document served from a different security zone [CVE-2009-1685]. Dean McNamee of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.WebKit does not properly determine the security context associated with scripts [CVE-2009-1688]. Adam Barth of UC Berkeley and Collin Jackson of Stanford University reported this vulnerability.A form submitted to 'about:blank' can synchronously replace the target document's security context, allowing currently-executing scripts to run in the new security context [CVE-2009-1689]. Adam Barth of UC Berkeley and Collin Jackson of Stanford University reported this vulnerability.A remote user can modify standard JavaScript prototypes of web sites served from a different domain [CVE-2009-1691].The contents of a frame can be accessed by an HTML document after a page transition has occurred [CVE-2009-1695]. Feng Qian of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.A web site can bypass the same-origin policy by issuing an XMLHttpRequest that does not contain an HTTP Host header [CVE-2009-1697]. Per von Zweigbergk reported this vulnerability.The handling of Location and History objects may permit cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2009-1702]. Adam Barth and Joel Weinberger of UC Berkeley reported this vulnerability.A flaw in Web Inspector in the processing of HTML attributes allows a page being inspected to run injected script with elevated privileges and can read the target user's file system [CVE-2009-1714]. Pengsu Cheng of Wuhan University reported this vulnerability.A flaw in Web Inspector allows a page being inspected to run injected script with elevated privileges and can read the target user's file system [CVE-2009-1715]. Collin Jackson of Stanford University and Adam Barth of UC Berkeley reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1714.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with a target site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-1716.title: Apple Safari Lets Local Users Access Files During Downloading
CVE-2009-1716.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple Safari. A local user can access files being downloaded by other users.The CFNetwork component creates insecure temporary files when downloading files. A local user can view files being downloaded by other users on the target system.Billy Rios and Microsoft Vulnerability Research reported this vulnerability.[Editor's note: This vulnerability was corrected on Mac OS X in version 10.5.6.]
CVE-2009-1716.extra: A local user can access files being downloaded by other users.

CVE-2009-1717.title: Apple Terminal Integer Overflow in Window Resizing Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1717.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X in Apple Terminal. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML (referencing xterm) that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow in Apple Terminal and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vulnerability resides in the processing of 'CSI[4' xterm window resizing escape code.The vendor was notified on May 6, 2009.Rob King, TippingPoint DVLabs, reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://dvlabs.tippingpoint.com/advisory/TPTI-09-04
CVE-2009-1717.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1720.title: Mac OS X Multiple Image and File Processing Bugs Permit Remote Code Execution
CVE-2009-1720.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted image or file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted image with an embedded ColorSync profile can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2009-1726]. Chris Evans of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted Canon RAW image can trigger a stack overflow [CVE-2009-1728]. Chris Ries of Carnegie Mellon University Computing Services reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted OpenEXR image can trigger a heap overflow in ImageIO [CVE-2009-1722]. Lurene Grenier of Sourcefire VRT and Chris Ries of Carnegie Mellon University Computing Services reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted OpenEXR image can trigger an uninitialized memory access error in ImageIO [CVE-2009-1721].A specially crafted OpenEXR image can trigger an integer overflow in ImageIO [CVE-2009-1720].An image with specially crafted EXIF metadata can trigger a buffer overflow in ImageIO [CVE-2009-2188]. Systems prior to Mac OS X v10.5 are not affected.A remote user can return a specially crafted AppleTalk response packet to trigger a buffer overflow in the kernel [CVE-2009-2193]. Ilja van Sprundel from IOActive reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted XML content can trigger a buffer overflow in the Perl Compatible Regular Expressions (PCRE) library used by XQuery in the processing of character classes in regular expressions [CVE-2008-0674].
CVE-2009-1720.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-1724.title: Apple Safari Flaw in WebKit in Processing Parent and Top Objects Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-1724.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.WebKit does not properly handle the parent and top objects. A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser in the context of an arbitrary site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2009-1724.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with an arbitrary site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-1725.title: Apple Safari WebKit Bug in Procesing Numeric Character References Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-1725.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML containing numeric character references that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in WebKit and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Chris Evans reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-1725.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
