A remote authenticated user can privileges of the target user.A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted Protected Extensible Authentication Protocol (PEAP) authentication requests to trigger a memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-2505]. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted Microsoft Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol version 2 (MS-CHAP v2) authentication request to obtain access to network resources with the privilege of a target user [CVE-2009-3677].
CVE-2009-2505.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote authenticated user can gain access privileges of the target user.

CVE-2009-2519.title: Microsoft DHTML Editing Component ActiveX Control Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2519.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Microsoft DHTML Editing Component ActiveX Control. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a flaw in the DHTML Editing Component ActiveX control and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Tavis Ormandy of Google reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2519.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-2564.title: Adobe Acrobat and Adobe Reader Flaws Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Deny Service
CVE-2009-2564.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Acrobat and Adobe Reader. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system. A local user can gain elevated privileges.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The following vulnerabilities may permit code execution:- memory corruption [CVE-2009-2985]- heap overflows [CVE-2009-2986]- invalid array index flaw [CVE-2009-2990], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- Mozilla plug-in flaw [CVE-2009-2991], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 8.1.7 updates- input validation flaws [CVE-2009-2993]- buffer overflow [CVE-2009-2994]- heap overflow [CVE-2009-2997]- input validation [CVE-2009-2998]- input validation [CVE-2009-3458]- memory corruption in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-3460], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- integer overflow in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-2989], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updatesThe following vulnerabilities permit denial of service and some may permit code execution:- memory corruption [CVE-2009-2983], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- integer overflow [CVE-2009-2980]- memory corruption [CVE-2009-2996]- format bug when running in Debug mode on UNIX [CVE-2009-3462]- image decoder flaw in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-2984], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 update.- input validation that may allow a bypass of Trust Manager restrictions [CVE-2009-2981].- an unspecified flaw in the file extension security controls that affects Acrobat versions 9.x [CVE-2009-3461].- a certificate flaw [CVE-2009-2982], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- a stack overflow [CVE-2009-3431], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- a flaw in XMP-XML entity expansion [CVE-2009-2979], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- a flaw in the ActiveX control, affecting Windows-based systems [CVE-2009-2987].- input validation [CVE-2009-2988]- input validation in the ActiveX control, affecting Windows-based systems [CVE-2009-2992], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates.- integer overflow in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-2995].- unspecified flaw in a third party web download product that may allow a local user to gain elevated privileges [CVE-2009-2564].The following researchers reported these vulnerabilities:Didier Stevens (CVE-2009-2979); Drew Yao of Apple Product Security (CVE-2009-2980); Stefano Di Paola of Minded Security (CVE-2009-2981); Guillaume Delugr and Fr d ric Raynal of SOGETI ESEC (CVE-2009-2982, CVE-2009-3461, CVE-2009-3462); SkyLined of Google Inc. (CVE-2009-2983); Tavis Ormandy, Google Security Team (CVE-2009-2984); An anonymous researcher via TippingPoint (CVE-2009-2985); Will Dormann, CERT (CVE-2009-2986); Zhenhua Liu and Xiaopeng Zhang of Fortinet's FortiGuard Global Security Research Team (CVE-2009-2987, CVE-2009-2988, CVE-2009-2996); Tielei Wang from ICST-ERCIS (Engineering Research Center of Info Security, Institute of Computer Science & Technology, Peking University / China) (CVE-2009-2989, CVE-2009-2995); Dionysus Blazakis via iDefense (CVE-2009-2990); Elazar Broad via iDefense (CVE-2009-2991); David Soldera of Next Generation Security Software (CVE-2009-2992); IOActive (CVE-2009-2993); Felipe Andres Manzano via iSIGHT Partners (CVE-2009-2994); Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Security (CVE-2009-2997, CVE-2009-2998, CVE-2009-3458); Haifei Li of Fortinet's FortiGuard Global Security Research Team (CVE-2009-3460).
CVE-2009-2564.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code or cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system.A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges.

CVE-2009-2570.title: Symantec WinFax Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2570.body: pyrokinesis and trotzkista from Nine:Situations:Group reported a vulnerability in Symantec WinFax. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke the Symantec Fax Viewer Control (DCCFAXVW.DLL) and trigger a buffer overflow to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: C05A1FBC-1413-11D1-B05F-00805F4945F6The original advisory and demonstration exploit is available at:http://retrogod.altervista.org/9sg_symantec_win_fuck_pro.html
CVE-2009-2570.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-2582.title: Akamai Download Manager Stack Overflow in Processing HTTP Responses Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2582.body: A vulnerability was reported in Akamai Download Manager. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will connect to a web site that will send a specially crafted HTTP response to trigger a stack overflow in 'manager.exe' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on February 10, 2009.Stephen Fewer of Harmony Security reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2009-2582.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-2583.title: IBM Tivoli Identity Manager Console and Self Service Interface Session Fixation Bug Lets Remote Users Hijack Sessions
CVE-2009-2583.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Tivoli Identity Manager. A remote user can hijack a target user's session.The console and self service interface contain a cross-site scripting flaw.No details were provided.
CVE-2009-2583.extra: A remote user can hijack a target user's session.

CVE-2009-2621.title: Squid Request and Response Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-2621.body: SeveraA vulnerabilities were reported in Squid. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted requests or responses to cause the target service to crash.The vulnerabilities are due to incorrect buffer size limits, incorrect bounds checking, and incorrect data validation.Rob Middleton of Centenary Institute, Tuomo Untinen, Ossi Herrala, and Jukka Taimisto from the CROSS project at Codenomicon Ltd., and Alex Montoanelli of www.unetvale.net reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-2621.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2009-2622.title: Squid Request and Response Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-2622.body: SeveraA vulnerabilities were reported in Squid. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted requests or responses to cause the target service to crash.The vulnerabilities are due to incorrect buffer size limits, incorrect bounds checking, and incorrect data validation.Rob Middleton of Centenary Institute, Tuomo Untinen, Ossi Herrala, and Jukka Taimisto from the CROSS project at Codenomicon Ltd., and Alex Montoanelli of www.unetvale.net reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-2622.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2009-2625.title: Java Runtime Environment (JRE) XML Parsing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-2625.body: A vulnerability was reported in Java Runtime Environment (JRE). A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create specially crafted XML to trigger a flaw in JRE in the parsing of XML data to cause unspecified denial of service conditions.CERT-FI and Jukka Taimisto, Tero Rontti, and Rauli Kaksonen from the CROSS project at Codenomicon Ltd reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2625.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2009-2627.title: Acer LunchApp ActiveX Control Unsafe Methods Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2627.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Acer LunchApp ActiveX Control. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will load the Acer AcerCtrls.APlunch ActiveX control and invoke unsafe methods to execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 3895DD35-7573-11D2-8FED-00606730D3AAMichael Costa of Crosshair Information Technology & Security LLC reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/485961
CVE-2009-2627.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-2631.title: Cisco ASA Clientless SSL VPN Feature Lets Remote Users Bypass Web Browser Same-Origin Policy Restrictions
CVE-2009-2631.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can bypass the same-origin policy restrictions provided by the web browser.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user via a clientless SSL VPN, will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the VPN or with arbitrary sites accessed via the VPN, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the sites, or take actions on the sites acting as the target user.The original advisory is available at:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/261869David Warren and Ryan Giobbi from US-CERT reported this vulnerability, based on initial research from Michael Zalewski.[Editor's notes: Products from several vendors are affected, including Cisco, Juniper, SafeNet, and SonicWall.]
CVE-2009-2631.extra: A remote user can bypass the same-origin policy restrictions provided by the web browser to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the VPN or with arbitrary sites accessed via the VPN, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the sites, or take actions on the sites acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-2636.title: Kerio MailServer Input Validation Hole in Integration Page Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-2636.body: A vulnerability was reported in Kerio MailServer. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The Integration page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can send a specially crafted URL via e-mail that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Kerio MailServer software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Behrang Fouladi of Sensepost reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2636.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Kerio MailServer software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-2649.title: FreeBSD IATA Driver IOCTL Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-2649.body: A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD Kernel. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can with read access to an IATA driver can invoke a specially crafted IOCTL to trigger a kernel panic.The original advisory is available at:http://milw0rm.com/exploits/9134Shaun Colley reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2649.extra: A local user can cause a kernel panic.

CVE-2009-2651.title: Asterisk RTP Frame Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-2651.body: A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted RTP text frames to cause the target service to crash.The vendor was notified on July 27, 2009.Marcus Hunger reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2651.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2009-2653.title: Windows Kernel win32k.sys Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2009-2653.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Windows XP kernel. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can invoke NtUserConsoleControl() in 'win32k.sys' to execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges.Demonstration exploit code is available at:http://www.ntinternals.org/win32k/NtUserConsoleControl_Exp.zipThe original advisory is available at:http://www.ntinternals.org/index.html#09_07_30alex from ntinternals.org reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2653.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2009-2654.title: Mozilla Firefox Invalid Character URL Bug Lets Remote Users Spoof URLs
CVE-2009-2654.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can spoof URLs.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will load an arbitrary URL containing an invalid character. The address bar will display a portion of the URL (spoofing a valid URL) and the browser will display arbitrary page contents instead of the invalid URL error page.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://es.geocities.com/jplopezy/firefoxspoofing.htmlJuan Pablo Lopez Yacubian reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2654.extra: A remote user can spoof URLs.

CVE-2009-2666.title: Fetchmail NULL Character Flaw in Common Name Field Lets Remote Users Spoof Certficiates
CVE-2009-2666.body: A vulnerability was reported in Fetchmail. A remote user can spoof certificates of arbitrary sites.A remote user can create a certificate with a specially crafted Common Name field OR subjectAltName field that contains a NULL character. Once the certificate is signed by a Certificate Authority, the certificate can be used to spoof a target site's certificate.
CVE-2009-2666.extra: A remote user can spoof certificates of arbitrary sites.

CVE-2009-2670.title: Java Runtime Environment Audio System Bug Lets Remote Users Access Java System Properties
CVE-2009-2670.body: A vulnerability was reported in Java Runtime Environment (JRE). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted applet or Web Start application that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit a flaw in the audio system gain access "java.lang.System" properties.Sami Koivu reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2670.extra: A remote user can create an applet or application that, when loaded by the target user, will access Java system properties.

CVE-2009-2672.title: Java Runtime Environment Proxy Mechanism Flaws Let Remote Applets Obtain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2009-2672.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) proxy mechanism. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive. A remote user can initiate socket or URL connections.A remote user can create a specially crafted applet or Web Start application that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit one of several flaws in the JRE SOCKS implementation.A remote user can obtain the username of the user running the applet or application.A remote user can obtain browser cookies, which may lead to session hijacking.A remote user can open socket or URL connections from the applet or application to arbitrary hosts.Gregory Fleischer reported some of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-2672.extra: A remote user can obtain the username of the user running the applet or application.A remote user can obtain browser cookies, which may lead to session hijacking.A remote user can connect to arbitrary ports on arbitrary hosts.

CVE-2009-2673.title: Java Runtime Environment Proxy Mechanism Flaws Let Remote Applets Obtain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2009-2673.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) proxy mechanism. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive. A remote user can initiate socket or URL connections.A remote user can create a specially crafted applet or Web Start application that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit one of several flaws in the JRE SOCKS implementation.A remote user can obtain the username of the user running the applet or application.A remote user can obtain browser cookies, which may lead to session hijacking.A remote user can open socket or URL connections from the applet or application to arbitrary hosts.Gregory Fleischer reported some of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-2673.extra: A remote user can obtain the username of the user running the applet or application.A remote user can obtain browser cookies, which may lead to session hijacking.A remote user can connect to arbitrary ports on arbitrary hosts.

CVE-2009-2685.title: HP Power Manager Stack Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2685.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP Power Manager Remote Agent. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can supply a specially crafted Login parameter value to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vendor was notified on June 25, 2009.Janek Vind reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.
CVE-2009-2685.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2009-2693.title: Tomcat WAR Deployment Directory Traversal Flaw May Cause Files to Be Created Outside of the Intended Directory
CVE-2009-2693.body: A vulnerability was reported in Tomcat. A remote user can cause files to be created in arbitrary directories on the target system.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can create a specially crafted WAR archive that, when deployed on the target system by an authorized user, will create files on target system that are located outside of the web root directory.Marc Schoenefeld of the Red Hat Security Response Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2693.extra: A remote user can cause files to be created in arbitrary locations on the target system.

CVE-2009-2698.title: Linux Kernel Null Pointer Dereference in udp_sendmsg() Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2009-2698.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux Kernel. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can trigger a null pointer dereference in udp_sendmsg() using the MSG_MORE flag to cause denial of service conditions or potentially execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.Tavis Ormandy and Julien Tinnes of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2698.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2009-2726.title: Asterisk Bug in Processing SIP Packets Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-2726.body: A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted SIP packets to cause the target service to consume all available stack memory for the SIP network thread and crash.The flaw is only exploitable in version 1.6.1 and later.Nick Baggott of Mu Dynamics reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2726.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2009-2730.title: GnuTLS NULL Character Flaw in Common Name Field Lets Remote Users Spoof Certficiates
CVE-2009-2730.body: A vulnerability was reported in GnuTLS. A remote user can spoof certificates of arbitrary sites.A remote user can create a certificate with a specially crafted Common Name field or Subject Alternative Name field that contains a NULL character. Once the certificate is signed by a Certificate Authority, the certificate can be used to spoof a target site's certificate.Dan Kaminsky reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2730.extra: A remote user can spoof certificates of arbitrary sites.

CVE-2009-2733.title: Achievo Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting, SQL Injection, and Include File Attacks
CVE-2009-2733.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Achievo. A remote user can include and execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted URL to cause the target system to include and execute arbitrary PHP code from a remote location. The PHP code, including operating system commands, will run with the privileges of the target web service.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2009-2733]. The code will originate from the site running the Achievo software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user. Ryan Dewhurst reported this vulnerability.The 'title' variable in the scheduler module is affected. The atksearch[contractnumber], atksearch_AE_customer[customer], and atksearchmode[contracttype] variables in the 'Organisation Contracts' administration page are affected.A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2009-2734]. The 'user_id' parameter in 'dispatch.php' is affected. Ryan Dewhurst reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2733.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary PHP code and operating system commands on the target system with the privileges of the target web service.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Achievo software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2009-2734.title: Achievo Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting, SQL Injection, and Include File Attacks
CVE-2009-2734.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Achievo. A remote user can include and execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted URL to cause the target system to include and execute arbitrary PHP code from a remote location. The PHP code, including operating system commands, will run with the privileges of the target web service.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2009-2733]. The code will originate from the site running the Achievo software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user. Ryan Dewhurst reported this vulnerability.The 'title' variable in the scheduler module is affected. The atksearch[contractnumber], atksearch_AE_customer[customer], and atksearchmode[contracttype] variables in the 'Organisation Contracts' administration page are affected.A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2009-2734]. The 'user_id' parameter in 'dispatch.php' is affected. Ryan Dewhurst reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2734.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary PHP code and operating system commands on the target system with the privileges of the target web service.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Achievo software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2009-2753.title: IBM Informix Dynamic Server Buffer Overflows in 'librpc.dll' Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2753.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Informix Dynamic Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted RPC data to trigger buffer overflows in the 'librpc.dll' RPC parsing library and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with System privileges on Windows-based systems.EMC Legato Networker is also affected.The vendor was notified on February 7, 2008.Sebastian Apelt reported this vulnerability via the Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2009-2753.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2009-2765.title: DD-WRT Web Interface Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2765.body: A vulnerability was reported in DD-WRT. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target device.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user on the internal network, will execute arbitrary commands on the target device. The code will run with root privileges.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/cgi-bin/;command_to_executeThe vulnerability can be exploited via Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks.The original advisory is available at:http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/9209gat3way reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2765.extra: A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user on the internal network, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-2783.title: XOOPS Input Validation Flaws in 'viewpmsg.php' and 'user.php' Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-2783.body: A vulnerability was reported in XOOPS. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Two scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the XOOPS software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The 'op' parameter of 'viewpmsg.php' and the query string of 'user.php' are affected.Some demonstration exploit URLs are provided:http://[target]/xoops-2.3.3/htdocs/modules/pm/viewpmsg.php?op='"><script>alert('vulnerable')</script><link id='http://[target]/xoops-2.3.3/htdocs/modules/profile/user.php?"><script>alert('vulnerable')</script>The vendor was notified on June 15, 2009.The original advisory is available at:http://www.senseofsecurity.com.au/advisories/SOS-09-005.pdfSense of Security reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2783.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the XOOPS software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-2807.title: CUPS Heap Overflow in USB Backend Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2009-2807.body: A vulnerability was reported in CUPS. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can exploit a flaw in the USB backend to trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code with system privileges.Mac OS X 10.5.x is affected.
CVE-2009-2807.extra: A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.

CVE-2009-2816.title: Apple Safari WebKit Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Cross-Origin Resource Sharing Controls
CVE-2009-2816.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can bypass cross-origin resource sharing controls.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the target user's browser to take actions on other web sites.The vulnerability resides in WebKit.
CVE-2009-2816.extra: A remote user can cause the target user's browser to take actions on other web sites.

CVE-2009-2822.title: Apple AirPort Base Station Lets Remote Users Access Restricted Networks
CVE-2009-2822.body: A vulnerability was reported in AirPort Base Station. A remote user can connect to a restricted network.When a network extender is used, a remote user can bypass the MAC address access control list and connect to a restricted network.Guido Lamberty reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2822.extra: A remote user can connect to a restricted network.

CVE-2009-2851.title: WordPress Input Validation Flaw in Comment Author URLs Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-2851.body: A vulnerability was reported in WordPress. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The administrative pages do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in comment author URLs before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target administrative user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the WordPress software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2009-2851.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the WordPress software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-2855.title: Squid Infinite Loop in strListGetItem() Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-2855.body: A vulnerability was reported in Squid. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP header values that use a comma character as a delimiter to cause the strListGetItem() function in 'src/HttpHeaderTools.c' to enter an infinite loop and consume all available CPU resources.Systems that have an 'external_acl_type', 'access_log_format', or 'external_refresh_check' configured using a delimiter that is not a comma are affected.Bastian Blank reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2855.extra: A remote user can the target service to enter an infinite loop and consume all available CPU resources.

CVE-2009-2862.title: Cisco IOS Object Groups for ACLs Lets Remote Users Bypass Access Controls
CVE-2009-2862.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS Object Groups for ACLs. A remote user can bypass access controls.On IOS devices configured with Object Groups for access control lists (ACLs), a remote user can bypass access control policies to access hosts and networks that are ostensibly protected by the device.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsx07114, CSCsu70214, CSCsw47076, CSCsv48603, CSCsy54122, and CSCsu50252 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2862.extra: A remote user can bypass access controls to access hosts and networks ostensibly protected by the target device.

CVE-2009-2863.title: Cisco IOS Authentication Proxy Race Condition Lets Remote Users Bypass Access Controls
CVE-2009-2863.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can bypass access controls.On IOS devices configured with Authentication Proxy for HTTP(S), Web Authentication, or the consent feature, a remote user can trigger a race condition to bypass the authentication proxy server or the consent web page and access the requested resource.Systems are affected if at least one valid authenticated session or accepted consent session exists.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsy15227 to this vulnerability.The Firewall Authentication Proxy for FTP and Telnet Sessions is not affected.
CVE-2009-2863.extra: A remote user can access ostensibly protected network resources.

CVE-2009-2865.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2865.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target Cisco IOS device.A remote user on a registered phone IP address can send specially crafted HTTP requests to trigger a buffer overflow in the login section of the Extension Mobility feature and execute arbitrary code or cause denial of service conditions.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsq58779 to this vulnerability.Cisco IOS devices configured for Cisco Unified CME and the Extension Mobility feature are affected.Cisco IOS devices configured for Survivable Remote Site Telephony (SRST) Mode are not affected.Cisco IOS XR is not affected.Cisco IOS XE is not affected.Cisco Unified Communications Manager is not affected.
CVE-2009-2865.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code or cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2009-2875.title: Cisco WebEx WRF Player Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2875.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco WebEx WRF Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted WRF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the Cisco WebEx Recording Format (WRF) Player and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The Cisco WebEx Player for the WebEx Advanced Recording Format (ARF) file format is not affected.Xiaopeng Zhang and Zhenhua Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-2875.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-2876.title: Cisco WebEx WRF Player Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2876.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco WebEx WRF Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted WRF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the Cisco WebEx Recording Format (WRF) Player and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The Cisco WebEx Player for the WebEx Advanced Recording Format (ARF) file format is not affected.Xiaopeng Zhang and Zhenhua Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-2876.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-2877.title: Cisco WebEx WRF Player Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2877.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco WebEx WRF Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted WRF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the Cisco WebEx Recording Format (WRF) Player and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The Cisco WebEx Player for the WebEx Advanced Recording Format (ARF) file format is not affected.Xiaopeng Zhang and Zhenhua Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-2877.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-2878.title: Cisco WebEx WRF Player Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2878.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco WebEx WRF Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted WRF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the Cisco WebEx Recording Format (WRF) Player and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The Cisco WebEx Player for the WebEx Advanced Recording Format (ARF) file format is not affected.Xiaopeng Zhang and Zhenhua Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-2878.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-2879.title: Cisco WebEx WRF Player Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2879.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco WebEx WRF Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted WRF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the Cisco WebEx Recording Format (WRF) Player and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The Cisco WebEx Player for the WebEx Advanced Recording Format (ARF) file format is not affected.Xiaopeng Zhang and Zhenhua Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-2879.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-2880.title: Cisco WebEx WRF Player Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2880.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco WebEx WRF Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted WRF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the Cisco WebEx Recording Format (WRF) Player and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The Cisco WebEx Player for the WebEx Advanced Recording Format (ARF) file format is not affected.Xiaopeng Zhang and Zhenhua Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-2880.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-2901.title: Tomcat Undeploy Failure May Allow Remote Users to Access Files
CVE-2009-2901.body: A vulnerability was reported in Tomcat. A remote user can access files in certain cases.When an undeploy fails, the remaining files will still be deployed by the auto-deployment process. A remote user may be able to access the files.
CVE-2009-2901.extra: A remote user can access files that should not have been deployed.

CVE-2009-2902.title: Tomcat WAR Deployment Directory Traversal Flaw May Cause Files to Be Deleted
CVE-2009-2902.body: A vulnerability was reported in Tomcat. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted WAR archived that, when deployed on the target system by an authorized user, will overwrite files on the target system.A WAR archive with the filename "...war" will cause the files and subdirectories in "work/<engine name>/<host name>" directory to be removed.The vendor reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2902.extra: A remote user can cause files to be deleted on the target system.

CVE-2009-2932.title: SAP NetWeaver Input Validation Flaw in UDDI Client Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-2932.body: A vulnerability was reported in SAP NetWeaver. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the SAP NetWeaver software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The 'TModel Key' parameter in '/uddiclient/process' is affected.The vendor was notified on March 18, 2009. The original advisory is available at:http://www.dsecrg.com/pages/vul/show.php?id=133Alexander Polyakov from Digital Security Research Group [DSecRG] reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2932.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the SAP NetWeaver software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-2935.title: Google Chrome Javascript Memory Access Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2935.body: A vulnerability was reported in Google Chrome. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted Javascript that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory read error and obtain potentially sensitive information from the target user's system. It may be possible to execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run within the Google Chrome sandbox.The vulnerability resides in the V8 Javascript engine.Mozilla Security reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2935.extra: A remote user can create Javascript that, when loaded by the target user, will obtain information from the target user's system or potentially execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-2948.title: Samba 'mount.cifs' Lets Local Users View Portions of Files on the Target System
CVE-2009-2948.body: A vulnerability was reported in Samba. A local user can view portions of files on the target system.On systems where 'mount.cifs' is installed as a set user id (setuid) program, a local user can invoke the program in verbose mode and supply a specially crafted credential or password path to view the first line of the specified path.Ronald Volgers reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2948.extra: A local user can view the first line of arbitrary files on the target system.

CVE-2009-2949.title: OpenOffice.org Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2949.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in OpenOffice.org. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted document that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted XPM file (or document containing an XPM object) can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2009-2949]. Sebastian Apelt from siberas reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted GIF file (or document containing a GIF image) can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2009-2950]. Frank Reissner and Sebastian Apelt from siberas reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted Microsoft Word document can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2009-3301, CVE-2009-3302]. Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Vulnerability Research Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2949.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-2950.title: OpenOffice.org Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-2950.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in OpenOffice.org. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted document that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted XPM file (or document containing an XPM object) can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2009-2949]. Sebastian Apelt from siberas reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted GIF file (or document containing a GIF image) can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2009-2950]. Frank Reissner and Sebastian Apelt from siberas reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted Microsoft Word document can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2009-3301, CVE-2009-3302]. Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Vulnerability Research Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2950.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-2966.title: Kaspersky Internet Security URL Parsing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-2966.body: A vulnerability was reported in Kaspersky Internet Security. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when processed by the target user's 'avp.exe' process, will cause the process to consume excessive CPU resources.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/.................[ .xY where 1024<Y]The vulnerability can also be exploited via HTML-based e-mail.Maksymilian Arciemowicz of SecurityReason.com reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2966.extra: A remote user can cause excessive CPU consumption on the target system.

CVE-2009-2966.title: Kaspersky Anti-Virus URL Parsing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-2966.body: A vulnerability was reported in Kaspersky Anti-Virus. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when processed by the target user's 'avp.exe' process, will cause the process to consume excessive CPU resources.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/.................[ .xY where 1024<Y]The vulnerability can also be exploited via HTML-based e-mail.Maksymilian Arciemowicz of SecurityReason.com reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-2966.extra: A remote user can cause excessive CPU consumption on the target system.

CVE-2009-2976.title: Cisco Access Points Disclose Potentially Sensitive Information and May Let Remote Users Hijack APs
CVE-2009-2976.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Access Points. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote user may be able to hijack access points.Some Cisco Access Points (APs) transmit unencrypted multicast data frames that include the MAC address and IP address of the wireless controller that the AP is connected to and AP configuration data. A remote user monitoring the wireless network can obtain this potentially sensitive information.When the Cisco Over-the-Air-Provisioning (OTAP) feature is enabled, a remote user can inject remote radio management (RRM) packets to cause a non-configured AP that is starting up to connect to an arbitrary wireless controller. Cisco Lightweight Wireless Access Point 1100 and 1200 Series devices are affected by this vulnerability.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtb56664 to this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.airmagnet.com/assets/AM_Technote_SkyJack_082509.pdfThe AirMagnet Intrusion Research Team reported this vulnerability.[Editor's note: Cisco has determined this to be a "denial of service" vulnerability because the target AP cannot connect to valid network resources. Cisco indicates that wireless clients will not be able to associate to attacker-controlled APs.]
CVE-2009-2976.extra: A remote user monitoring the wireless network can obtain potentially sensitive network information.A remote user may be able to hijack an arbitrary access point.

CVE-2009-2980.title: Adobe Acrobat and Adobe Reader Flaws Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Deny Service
CVE-2009-2980.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Acrobat and Adobe Reader. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system. A local user can gain elevated privileges.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The following vulnerabilities may permit code execution:- memory corruption [CVE-2009-2985]- heap overflows [CVE-2009-2986]- invalid array index flaw [CVE-2009-2990], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- Mozilla plug-in flaw [CVE-2009-2991], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 8.1.7 updates- input validation flaws [CVE-2009-2993]- buffer overflow [CVE-2009-2994]- heap overflow [CVE-2009-2997]- input validation [CVE-2009-2998]- input validation [CVE-2009-3458]- memory corruption in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-3460], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- integer overflow in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-2989], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updatesThe following vulnerabilities permit denial of service and some may permit code execution:- memory corruption [CVE-2009-2983], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- integer overflow [CVE-2009-2980]- memory corruption [CVE-2009-2996]- format bug when running in Debug mode on UNIX [CVE-2009-3462]- image decoder flaw in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-2984], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 update.- input validation that may allow a bypass of Trust Manager restrictions [CVE-2009-2981].- an unspecified flaw in the file extension security controls that affects Acrobat versions 9.x [CVE-2009-3461].- a certificate flaw [CVE-2009-2982], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- a stack overflow [CVE-2009-3431], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- a flaw in XMP-XML entity expansion [CVE-2009-2979], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- a flaw in the ActiveX control, affecting Windows-based systems [CVE-2009-2564].The following researchers reported these vulnerabilities:Didier Stevens (CVE-2009-2979); Drew Yao of Apple Product Security (CVE-2009-2980); Stefano Di Paola of Minded Security A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system. A local user can gain elevated privileges.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The following vulnerabilities may permit code execution:- memory corruption [CVE-2009-2985]- heap overflows [CVE-2009-2986]- invalid array index flaw [CVE-2009-2990], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- Mozilla plug-in flaw [CVE-2009-2991], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 8.1.7 updates- input validation flaws [CVE-2009-2993]- buffer overflow [CVE-2009-2994]- heap overflow [CVE-2009-2997]- input validation [CVE-2009-2998]- input validation [CVE-2009-3458]- memory corruption in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-3460], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- integer overflow in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-2989], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updatesThe following vulnerabilities permit denial of service and some may permit code execution:- memory corruption [CVE-2009-2983], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- integer overflow [CVE-2009-2980]- memory corruption [CVE-2009-2996]- format bug when running in Debug mode on UNIX [CVE-2009-3462]- image decoder flaw in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-2984], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 update.- input validation that may allow a bypass of Trust Manager restrictions [CVE-2009-2981].- an unspecified flaw in the file extension security controls that affects Acrobat versions 9.x [CVE-2009-3461].- a certificate flaw [CVE-2009-2982], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- a stack overflow [CVE-2009-3431], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- a flaw in XMP-XML entity expansion [CVE-2009-2979], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- a flaw in the ActiveX control, affecting Windows-based systems [CVE-2009-2987].- input validation [CVE-2009-2988]- input validation in the ActiveX control, affecting Windows-based systems [CVE-2009-2992], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates.- integer overflow in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-2995].- unspecified flaw in a third party web download product that may allow a local user to gain elevated privileges [CVE-2009-2564].The following researchers reported these vulnerabilities:Didier Stevens (CVE-2009-2979); Drew Yao of Apple Product Security (CVE-2009-2980); Stefano Di Paola of Minded Security (CVE-2009-2981); Guillaume Delugr and Fr d ric Raynal of SOGETI ESEC (CVE-2009-2982, CVE-2009-3461, CVE-2009-3462); SkyLined of Google Inc. (CVE-2009-2983); Tavis Ormandy, Google Security Team (CVE-2009-2984); An anonymous researcher via TippingPoint (CVE-2009-2985); Will Dormann, CERT (CVE-2009-2986); Zhenhua Liu and Xiaopeng Zhang of Fortinet's FortiGuard Global Security Research Team (CVE-2009-2987, CVE-2009-2988, CVE-2009-2996); Tielei Wang from ICST-ERCIS (Engineering Research Center of Info Security, Institute of Computer Science & Technology, Peking University / China) (CVE-2009-2989, CVE-2009-2995); Dionysus Blazakis via iDefense (CVE-2009-2990); Elazar Broad via iDefense (CVE-2009-2991); David Soldera of Next Generation Security Software (CVE-2009-2992); IOActive (CVE-2009-2993); Felipe Andres Manzano via iSIGHT Partners (CVE-2009-2994); Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Security (CVE-2009-2997, CVE-2009-2998, CVE-2009-3458); Haifei Li of Fortinet's FortiGuard Global Security Research Team (CVE-2009-3460).
CVE-2009-2996.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code or cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system.A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges.

CVE-2009-3009.title: Ruby on Rails Input Validation Flaw in Form Helpers Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-3009.body: A vulnerability was reported in Ruby on Rails. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The escaping code for the form helpers does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted Unicode string that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Ruby on Rails software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Brian Mastenbrook reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3009.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Ruby on Rails software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-3027.title: Symantec Veritas Storage Foundation Input Validation Flaw in VRTSweb Component Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3027.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Veritas Storage Foundation. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the VRTSweb component on port 14300 to trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with administrative privileges.The following Veritas Storage Foundation products are also affected:Symantec Veritas Storage Foundation for Windows High Availability (SFWHA)Symantec Veritas Storage Foundation for High Availability (SFHA)Symantec Veritas Storage Foundation for Oracle (SFO)Symantec Veritas Storage Foundation for DB2Symantec Veritas Storage Foundation for SybaseSymantec Veritas Storage Foundation for Oracle Real Application Cluster (SFRAC)Symantec Veritas Storage Foundation Manager (SFM)Symantec Veritas Storage Foundation Cluster File System (SFCFS)Symantec Veritas Storage Foundation Cluster File System for Oracle RAC (SFCFS RAC)Several other Symantec products are affected.An anonymous reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.
CVE-2009-3027.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2009-3027.title: Symantec Veritas NetBackup Manager Input Validation Flaw in VRTSweb Component Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3027.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Veritas NetBackup Operations Manager (NOM) and Symantec Veritas Backup Reporter (VBR). A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the VRTSweb component on port 14300 to trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with administrative privileges.Symantec Veritas NetBackup RealTime Protection is not affected in the default configuration.Several other Symantec products are affected.An anonymous reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.
CVE-2009-3027.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2009-3027.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2009-3029.title: Symantec SecurityExpressions Audit and Compliance Server Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-3029.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec SecurityExpressions Audit and Compliance Server. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The console not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input in error messages. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code and HTML to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Symantec SecurityExpressions software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Nate Roberts of Wipfli, LLP reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3029.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Symantec SecurityExpressions software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-3078.title: Mozilla Firefox Default Window Font May Let Remote Users Spoof the Location Bar Contents
CVE-2009-3078.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can spoof URLs displayed in the location bar.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when displayed in the location bar, will display certain Unicode characters with tall line-height. This may cause the displayed URL to appear to be different than the actual URL.Juan Pablo Lopez Yacubian and Corrie Sloot separately reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3078.extra: A remote user can spoof URLs displayed in the location bar.

CVE-2009-3079.title: Mozilla Firefox feedWriter Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3079.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted JavaScript that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary scripting code on the target system. The code will run with Chrome privileges.moz_bug_r_a4 reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3079.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3103.title: Windows Server Message Block NEGOTIATE PROTOCOL REQUEST Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3103.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Server Message Block. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted SMB header NEGOTIATE PROTOCOL REQUEST data to trigger a flaw in 'srv2.sys' and cause the target system to crash or execute arbitrary code.A "&" character in the "Process Id High" SMB header field can trigger a crash.Laurent Gaffie reported this vulnerability as a denial of service vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://g-laurent.blogspot.com/2009/09/windows-vista7-smb20-negotiate-protocol.htmlOn September 8, 2009, Ruben Santamarta reported that remote code execution is possible:http://www.reversemode.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=64&Itemid=1Microsoft indicates that Windows Vista, Windows Server 2008, and Windows 7 RC are affected, but Windows 7 RTM is not affected. The researcher's original report indicates that Windows 7 is affected [by the denial of service vulnerability].
CVE-2009-3103.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to crash.A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2009-3107.title: Symantec Altiris Deployment Solution Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Modify the Configuration, Execute Arbitrary Commands, and Deny Service
CVE-2009-3107.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Symantec Altiris Deployment Solution. A remote user can modify the configuration and execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can bypass authentication and supply commands to the DBManager to modify the Altiris Database. The remote user can add or remove users and access or modify currently scheduled tasks, affecting managed clients.A local user can modify the Aclient GUI software to include arbitrary code. When the target user subsequently runs the GUI, the arbitrary code will be executed with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can bypass authentication between the AClient agent and the deployment server (just prior to the authentication handshake) to execute arbitrary commands on the target agent system. The commands will run with System privileges.A remote user can exploit a race condition to download files to the target client system. Affected client systems will fail to receive certain updates.Luke Jennings of MWRInfosecurity reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3107.extra: A remote user can modify the Altiris Database.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target client system.A remote user can cause client systems to fail to receive certain updates.A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system with System level privileges.

CVE-2009-3108.title: Symantec Altiris Deployment Solution Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Modify the Configuration, Execute Arbitrary Commands, and Deny Service
CVE-2009-3108.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Symantec Altiris Deployment Solution. A remote user can modify the configuration and execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can bypass authentication and supply commands to the DBManager to modify the Altiris Database. The remote user can add or remove users and access or modify currently scheduled tasks, affecting managed clients.A local user can modify the Aclient GUI software to include arbitrary code. When the target user subsequently runs the GUI, the arbitrary code will be executed with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can bypass authentication between the AClient agent and the deployment server (just prior to the authentication handshake) to execute arbitrary commands on the target agent system. The commands will run with System privileges.A remote user can exploit a race condition to download files to the target client system. Affected client systems will fail to receive certain updates.Luke Jennings of MWRInfosecurity reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3108.extra: A remote user can modify the Altiris Database.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target client system.A remote user can cause client systems to fail to receive certain updates.A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system with System level privileges.

CVE-2009-3127.title: Microsoft Excel Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3127.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Excel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The Open XML File Format Converter for Mac is also affected.The Microsoft Office Excel Viewer is also affected.The Microsoft Office Compatibility Pack for Word, Excel, and PowerPoint is also affected.TippingPoint, Bing Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs, Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs, and Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Security reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3127.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
