A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The Open XML File Format Converter for Mac is also affected.The Microsoft Office Excel Viewer is also affected.The Microsoft Office Compatibility Pack for Word, Excel, and PowerPoint is also affected.TippingPoint, Bing Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs, Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs, and Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Security reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3132.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3133.title: Microsoft Excel Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3133.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Excel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The Open XML File Format Converter for Mac is also affected.The Microsoft Office Excel Viewer is also affected.The Microsoft Office Compatibility Pack for Word, Excel, and PowerPoint is also affected.TippingPoint, Bing Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs, Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs, and Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Security reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3133.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3134.title: Microsoft Excel Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3134.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Excel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The Open XML File Format Converter for Mac is also affected.The Microsoft Office Excel Viewer is also affected.The Microsoft Office Compatibility Pack for Word, Excel, and PowerPoint is also affected.TippingPoint, Bing Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs, Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs, and Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Security reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3134.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3135.title: Microsoft Word Memory Corruption Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3135.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Word. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a Word document with a specially crafted File Information Block (FIB) record that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Open XML File Format Converter for Mac is also affected.Microsoft Office Word Viewer is also affected.The vendor was notified on March 6, 2009.Jun Mao of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3135.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3200.title: QNAP Storage Devices Lets Local Users Decrypt Files on the Target Device
CVE-2009-3200.body: A vulnerability was reported in QNAP Storage Devices. A local user can decrypt the file system.A local user can recover the key used to encrypt files on the storage device and then decrypt the files.This vulnerability affects the TS-239 Pro and TS-639 Pro devices and possibly other devices.Marc Heuse of Baseline Security Consulting reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.baseline-security.de/downloads/BSC-Qnap_Crypto_Backdoor-CVE-2009-3200.txt
CVE-2009-3200.extra: A local user can decrypt the file system.

CVE-2009-3244.title: Shockwave Invalid Index and Pointer Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3244.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Shockwave. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create specially crafted Shockwave content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An invalid index vulnerability can cause code execution [CVE-2009-3463].Some invalid pointer vulnerabilities can cause code execution [CVE-2009-3464, CVE-2009-3465].An invalid string length vulnerability can cause code execution [CVE-2009-3466].A boundary condition can cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2009-3244].Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Security reported most of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3244.extra: A remote user can create Shockwave content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code or cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3262.title: IBM Tivoli Identity Manager Input Validation Flaw in SSUI Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-3262.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Tivoli Identity Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The Self Service User Interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can submit a specially crafted Last Name parameter value that will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the IBM Tivoli Identity Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2009-3262.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the IBM Tivoli Identity Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-3281.title: VMware Fusion vmx86 Kernel Extension Bugs Let Local Host OS Users Gain Elevated Privileges and Deny Service on the Host System
CVE-2009-3281.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in VMware Fusion. A local user on the host operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target host operating system. A local user on the host operating system can cause denial of service conditions on the host operating system.A local user on the host operating system can exploit a file permission error in the vmx86 kernel extension to execute arbitrary code in the host system kernel context [CVE-2009-3281]. A local user on the host operating system can trigger an integer overflow vulnerability in the vmx86 kernel extension to deny service to the host operating system [CVE-2009-3282].Neil Kettle of Convergent Network Solutions reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3281.extra: A local user on the host operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target host operating system.A local user on the host operating system can cause denial of service conditions on the host operating system.

CVE-2009-3282.title: VMware Fusion vmx86 Kernel Extension Bugs Let Local Host OS Users Gain Elevated Privileges and Deny Service on the Host System
CVE-2009-3282.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in VMware Fusion. A local user on the host operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target host operating system. A local user on the host operating system can cause denial of service conditions on the host operating system.A local user on the host operating system can exploit a file permission error in the vmx86 kernel extension to execute arbitrary code in the host system kernel context [CVE-2009-3281]. A local user on the host operating system can trigger an integer overflow vulnerability in the vmx86 kernel extension to deny service to the host operating system [CVE-2009-3282].Neil Kettle of Convergent Network Solutions reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3282.extra: A local user on the host operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target host operating system.A local user on the host operating system can cause denial of service conditions on the host operating system.

CVE-2009-3291.title: PHP Bugs Have Unspecified Impact
CVE-2009-3291.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in PHP. The impact was not specified.A certificate validation flaw exists in php_openssl_apply_verification_policy.An input validation flaw exists in the color index in imagecolortransparent().An input validation flaw exists in exif processing.

CVE-2009-3301.title: OpenOffice.org Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3301.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in OpenOffice.org. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted document that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted XPM file (or document containing an XPM object) can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2009-2949]. Sebastian Apelt from siberas reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted GIF file (or document containing a GIF image) can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2009-2950]. Frank Reissner and Sebastian Apelt from siberas reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted Microsoft Word document can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2009-3301, CVE-2009-3302]. Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Vulnerability Research Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3301.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3302.title: OpenOffice.org Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3302.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in OpenOffice.org. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted document that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted XPM file (or document containing an XPM object) can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2009-2949]. Sebastian Apelt from siberas reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted GIF file (or document containing a GIF image) can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2009-2950]. Frank Reissner and Sebastian Apelt from siberas reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted Microsoft Word document can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2009-3301, CVE-2009-3302]. Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Vulnerability Research Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3302.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3341.title: Linksys WRT54GL Router Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3341.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linksys WRT54GL Router. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vendor has been notified.This vulnerability was reported in the VulnDisco version 8.10 release [July 13, 2009].
CVE-2009-3341.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2009-3347.title: D-Link DIR-400 Router Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3347.body: A vulnerability was reported in the D-Link DIR-400 Router. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.This vulnerability was reported in the VulnDisco version 8.10 release [July 13, 2009].
CVE-2009-3347.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2009-3388.title: Mozilla Firefox Bugs in liboggplay Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3388.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted media file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory error in liboggplay and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.David Keeler and Bob Clary reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3388.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3388.title: Mozilla Seamonkey Bugs in liboggplay Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3388.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Seamonkey. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted media file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory error in liboggplay and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.David Keeler and Bob Clary reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3388.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3431.title: Adobe Acrobat and Adobe Reader Flaws Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Deny Service
CVE-2009-3431.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Acrobat and Adobe Reader. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system. A local user can gain elevated privileges.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The following vulnerabilities may permit code execution:- memory corruption [CVE-2009-2985]- heap overflows [CVE-2009-2986]- invalid array index flaw [CVE-2009-2990], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- Mozilla plug-in flaw [CVE-2009-2991], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 8.1.7 updates- input validation flaws [CVE-2009-2993]- buffer overflow [CVE-2009-2994]- heap overflow [CVE-2009-2997]- input validation [CVE-2009-2998]- input validation [CVE-2009-3458]- memory corruption in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-3460], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- integer overflow in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-2989], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updatesThe following vulnerabilities permit denial of service and some may permit code execution:- memory corruption [CVE-2009-2983], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- integer overflow [CVE-2009-2980]- memory corruption [CVE-2009-2996]- format bug when running in Debug mode on UNIX [CVE-2009-3462]- image decoder flaw in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-2984], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 update.- input validation that may allow a bypass of Trust Manager restrictions [CVE-2009-2981].- an unspecified flaw in the file extension security controls that affects Acrobat versions 9.x [CVE-2009-3461].- a certificate flaw [CVE-2009-2982], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- a stack overflow [CVE-2009-3431], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- a flaw in XMP-XML entity expansion [CVE-2009-2979], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- a flaw in the ActiveX control, affecting Windows-based systems [CVE-2009-2987].- input validation [CVE-2009-2988]- input validation in the ActiveX control, affecting Windows-based systems [CVE-2009-2992], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates.- integer overflow in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-2995].- unspecified flaw in a third party web download product that may allow a local user to gain elevated privileges [CVE-2009-2564].The following researchers reported these vulnerabilities:Didier Stevens (CVE-2009-2979); Drew Yao of Apple Product Security (CVE-2009-2980); Stefano Di Paola of Minded Security (CVE-2009-2981); Guillaume Delugr and Fr d ric Raynal of SOGETI ESEC (CVE-2009-2982, CVE-2009-3461, CVE-2009-3462); SkyLined of Google Inc. (CVE-2009-2983); Tavis Ormandy, Google Security Team (CVE-2009-2984); An anonymous researcher via TippingPoint (CVE-2009-2985); Will Dormann, CERT (CVE-2009-2986); Zhenhua Liu and Xiaopeng Zhang of Fortinet's FortiGuard Global Security Research Team (CVE-2009-2987, CVE-2009-2988, CVE-2009-2996); Tielei Wang from ICST-ERCIS (Engineering Research Center of Info Security, Institute of Computer Science & Technology, Peking University / China) (CVE-2009-2989, CVE-2009-2995); Dionysus Blazakis via iDefense (CVE-2009-2990); Elazar Broad via iDefense (CVE-2009-2991); David Soldera of Next Generation Security Software (CVE-2009-2992); IOActive (CVE-2009-2993); Felipe Andres Manzano via iSIGHT Partners (CVE-2009-2994); Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Security (CVE-2009-2997, CVE-2009-2998, CVE-2009-3458); Haifei Li of Fortinet's FortiGuard Global Security Research Team (CVE-2009-3460).
CVE-2009-3431.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code or cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system.A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges.

CVE-2009-3444.title: e107 Input Validation Hole in 'email.php' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-3444.body: A vulnerability was reported in e107. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The 'email.php?news.1' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the HTTP Referer header before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the e107 website system software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A demonstration exploit value is provided:Referer: '><script>alert(document.cookie)</script>The original advisory is available at:http://websecurity.com.ua/3528/MustLive reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3444.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the e107 website system software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-3448.title: BakBone NetVault Flaw Lets Remote Users Crash the 'npvmgr.exe' Service
CVE-2009-3448.body: A vulnerability was reported in NetVault. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP or UDP port 20031 to cause the target 'npvmgr.exe' service to crash.AbdulAziz Hariri reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3448.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2009-3453.title: Lotus Quickr Input Validation Flaw in Document Properties Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-3453.body: A vulnerability was reported in Lotus Quickr. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from certain document properties before displaying the information. A remote user can create a document with specially crafted document property values that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Lotus Quickr software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Lotus Quickr for WebSphere Portal is affected.
CVE-2009-3453.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Lotus Quickr software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-3457.title: Cisco Application Control Engine XML Gateway Discloses Internal IP Addresses to Remote Users
CVE-2009-3457.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco Application Control Engine (ACE) XML Gateway. A remote user can determine internal IP addresses.A remote user can send a specially crafted request to the target Cisco ACE XML Gateway (AXG) to cause the gateway to disclose the internal IP addresses of the AXG client.The Cisco ACE Web Application Firewall (WAF) is also affected.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtb82159 to this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.brainoverflow.org/advisories/cisco_ace_xml_gw_ip_disclosure.txt Alejandro Hernandez H. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3457.extra: A remote user can determine certain internal IP addresses.

CVE-2009-3458.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Acrobat and Adobe Reader. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system. A local user can gain elevated privileges.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The following vulnerabilities may permit code execution:- memory corruption [CVE-2009-2985]- heap overflows [CVE-2009-2986]- invalid array index flaw [CVE-2009-2990], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- Mozilla plug-in flaw [CVE-2009-2991], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 8.1.7 updates- input validation Reader [CVE-2009-3460], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- integer overflow in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-2989], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updatesThe following CVE-2009-3458.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code or cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system.A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges.

CVE-2009-3460.title: Adobe Acrobat and Adobe Reader Flaws Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Deny Service
CVE-2009-3460.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Acrobat and Adobe Reader. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system. A local user can gain elevated privileges.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The following vulnerabilities may permit code execution:- memory corruption [CVE-2009-2985]- heap overflows [CVE-2009-2986]- invalid array index flaw [CVE-2009-2990], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- Mozilla plug-in flaw [CVE-2009-2991], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 8.1.7 updates- input validation flaws [CVE-2009-2993]- buffer overflow [CVE-2009-2994]- heap overflow [CVE-2009-2997]- input validation [CVE-2009-2998]- input validation [CVE-2009-3458]- memory corruption in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-3460], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- integer overflow in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-2989], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updatesThe following vulnerabilities permit denial of service and some may permit code execution:- memory corruption [CVE-2009-2983], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- integer overflow [CVE-2009-2980]- memory corruption [CVE-2009-2996]- format bug when running in Debug mode on UNIX [CVE-2009-3462]- image decoder flaw in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-2984], fixed in the Acrobat 9.2 update.- input validation that may allow a bypass of Trust Manager restrictions [CVE-2009-2981].- an unspecified flaw in the file extension security controls that affects Acrobat versions 9.x [CVE-2009-3461].- a certificate flaw [CVE-2009-2982], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- a stack overflow [CVE-2009-3431], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- a flaw in XMP-XML entity expansion [CVE-2009-2979], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates- a flaw in the ActiveX control, affecting Windows-based systems [CVE-2009-2987].- input validation [CVE-2009-2988]- input validation in the ActiveX control, affecting Windows-based systems [CVE-2009-2992], fixed in the Adobe Reader and Acrobat 9.2 and 8.1.7 updates.- integer overflow in Acrobat but not Adobe Reader [CVE-2009-2995].- unspecified flaw in a third party web download product that may allow a local user to gain elevated privileges [CVE-2009-2564].The following researchers reported these vulnerabilities:Didier Stevens (CVE-2009-2979); Drew Yao of Apple Product Security (CVE-2009-2980); Stefano Di Paola of Minded Security (CVE-2009-2981); Guillaume Delugr and Fr d ric Raynal of SOGETI ESEC (CVE-2009-2982, CVE-2009-3461, CVE-2009-3462); SkyLined of Google Inc. (CVE-2009-2983); Tavis Ormandy, Google Security Team (CVE-2009-2984); An anonymous researcher via TippingPoint (CVE-2009-2985); Will Dormann, CERT (CVE-2009-2986); Zhenhua Liu and Xiaopeng Zhang of Fortinet's FortiGuard Global Security Research Team (CVE-2009-2987, CVE-2009-2988, CVE-2009-2996); Tielei Wang from ICST-ERCIS (Engineering Research Center of Info Security, Institute of Computer Science & Technology, Peking University / China) (CVE-2009-2989, CVE-2009-2995); Dionysus Blazakis via iDefense (CVE-2009-2990); Elazar Broad via iDefense (CVE-2009-2991); David Soldera of Next Generation Security Software (CVE-2009-2992); IOActive (CVE-2009-2993); Felipe Andres Manzano via iSIGHT Partners (CVE-2009-2994); Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Security (CVE-2009-2997, CVE-2009-2998, CVE-2009-3458); Haifei Li of Fortinet's FortiGuard Global Security Research Team (CVE-2009-3460).
CVE-2009-3460.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code or cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system.A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges.

CVE-2009-3463.title: Shockwave Invalid Index and Pointer Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3463.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Shockwave. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create specially crafted Shockwave content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An invalid index vulnerability can cause code execution [CVE-2009-3463].Some invalid pointer vulnerabilities can cause code execution [CVE-2009-3464, CVE-2009-3465].An invalid string length vulnerability can cause code execution [CVE-2009-3466].A boundary condition can cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2009-3244].Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Security reported most of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3463.extra: A remote user can create Shockwave content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code or cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3469.title: IBM Lotus Connections Input Validation Flaw in 'simpleSearch.do' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-3469.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Lotus Connections. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The 'simpleSearch.do' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'name' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the IBM Lotus Connections software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:https://[target]/profiles/html/simpleSearch.do?name=<IMG%20SRC="vbscript:msgbox(document.cookie)'>〈=en
CVE-2009-3469.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the IBM Lotus Connections software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-3470.title: IBM Informix Dynamic Server JDBC Connection Password Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-3470.body: A vulnerability was reported in Informix Dynamic Server. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can a send specially crafted password value via a JDBC connection to trigger a memory corruption error and cause an assertion failure or cause the target service to crash.A password that is more than 512 bytes length can trigger the flaw.
CVE-2009-3470.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2009-3477.title: Blackberry OS NULL Character Flaw in Common Name Field Lets Remote Users Spoof Certficiates
CVE-2009-3477.body: A vulnerability was reported in Blackberry OS. A remote user can spoof certificates of arbitrary sites.A remote user can create a certificate with a specially crafted Common Name field that contains a NULL character. Once the certificate is signed by a Certificate Authority, the certificate can be used to spoof a target site's certificate. The browser will correctly detect the mismatch between the certificate and the domain name. However, the resulting dialog box to warn the user of the mismatch does not display null characters, which may confuse some users and cause them to connect to the spoofed site.Mobile Security Lab and CESG separately reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3477.extra: A remote user can spoof certificates of arbitrary sites.

CVE-2009-3522.title: avast! 'aswMon2.sys' IOCTL Memory Corruption Flaw May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2009-3522.body: A vulnerability was reported in avast!. A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges.A local user can supply a specially crafted B2C80018 IOCTL value to the 'aswMon2.sys' driver to trigger a memory corruption error in the kernel.The vendor was notified on September 15, 2009.The original advisory is available at:https://www.evilfingers.com/advisory/Advisory/Avast_aswMon2.sys_kernel_memory_corruption_and_Local_Privilege_Escalation.phpGiuseppe 'Evilcry' Bonfa' reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3522.extra: A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2009-3525.title: Xen PyGrub Access Control Flaw Lets Local Users Modify the Boot Configuration
CVE-2009-3525.body: A vulnerability was reported in Xen PyGrub. A physically local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.When 'grub.conf' is configured with password protection, the system does not check for the password at host boot time. A physically local user can modify the file to change the OS booting configuration.Jan Lieskovsky reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3525.extra: A physically local user can modify the OS booting configuration.

CVE-2009-3554.title: JBoss Enterprise Application Platform Discloses JMX Password to Local Users
CVE-2009-3554.body: A vulnerability was reported in JBoss Enterprise Application Platform. A local user can obtain the JMX password.The twiddle command line client logs the JMX password in plain text to the 'twiddle.log' file. A local user can obtain the password.Dennis Reed reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3554.extra: A local user can obtain the JMX password.

CVE-2009-3560.title: expat Buffer Over-read in big2_toUtf8() Lets Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-3560.body: A vulnerability was reported in expat. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create an XML document containing specially crafted UTF-8 sequences that, when processed using libexpat, will trigger a buffer over-read in the big2_toUtf8() function and crash the target application.The vulnerability resides in 'lib/xmltok.c'.
CVE-2009-3560.extra: A remote user can cause the target application to crash.

CVE-2009-3565.title: McAfee IntruShield NSM Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-3565.body: A vulnerability was reported in McAfee IntruShield Network Security Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The 'Login.jsp' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'iaction' and 'node' parameters before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the McAfee IntruShield device and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The original advisory is available at:http://www.secureworks.com/ctu/advisories/SWRX-2009-001/Dan King of SecureWorks reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3565.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the McAfee IntruShield interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-3566.title: McAfee IntruShield Network Security Manager Permits Session Hijacking Attacks
CVE-2009-3566.body: A vulnerability was reported in McAfee IntruShield Network Security Manager. A remote user can conduct session hijacking attacks.The server does not set the 'HttpOnly' tag on authentication cookies. A remote user can obtain the cookies (via a cross-site scripting attack, for example) to gain access to the target user's session.Dan King of SecureWorks reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3566.extra: A remote user can access the target user's authentication cookies.

CVE-2009-3569.title: OpenOffice Unspecified Flaws Have Unspecified Impact
CVE-2009-3569.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenOffice. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted document that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An additional vulnerability exists. The impact was not specified.This vulnerability was reported in the VulnDisco version 8.8 release [May 11, 2009].
CVE-2009-3569.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3576.title: Autodesk Softimage Scene Table of Contents XML File Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3576.body: A vulnerability was reported in Autodesk Softimage. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted scene table of contents XML ('.scntoc') file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on August 25, 2009.Diego Juarez, Fernando Arnaboldi, and Federico Charosky from Core Security Technologies reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3576.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3577.title: Autodesk 3ds Max Application Callbacks Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3577.body: A vulnerability was reported in Autodesk 3ds Max. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a '.max' file containing embedded application callbacks that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on August 25, 2009.Sebastian Tello from Core Security Technologies reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3577.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3578.title: Autodesk Maya 'Script Nodes' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3578.body: A vulnerability was reported in Autodesk Maya. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted scene package containing embedded scripting code that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on August 25, 2009.Diego Juarez from Core Security Technologies reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3578.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3603.title: Xpdf Integer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3603.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Xpdf. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted PDF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The SplashBitmap() function in 'SplashBitmap.c' is affected [CVE-2009-3603].The drawImage() function in 'splash.c' is affected [CVE-2009-3604].The doImageL1Sep() function in 'PSOutputDev.c' is affected [CVE-2009-3606].The ObjectStream() function in 'ObjectStream.c' is affected [CVE-2009-3608].The ImageStream() function in 'ImageStream.c' is affected [CVE-2009-3609].
CVE-2009-3603.extra: A remote user can create a PDF file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3622.title: WordPress 'wp-trackbacks.php' Multi-byte Encodincg Detection Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3622.body: A vulnerability was reported in WordPress. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted series of requests containing multibyte encodings to cause the target 'wp-trackbacks.php' script to consume excessive CPU resources.This vulnerability is being actively exploited.Systems that have trackbacks disabled are still affected.Demonstration exploit code is available at:http://rooibo.wordpress.com/2009/10/17/agujero-de-seguridad-en-wordpress/Jose Carlos Norte reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3622.extra: A remote user can cause excessive CPU consumption on the target system.

CVE-2009-3671.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Memory Access Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3671.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer (IE). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will access an object that has not been correctly initialized or has been deleted and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Ryan Smith of Verisign IDefense Labs, team509 via iDefense, Sam Thomas of eshu.co.uk via TippingPoint, and anonymous researchers via TippingPoint reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3671.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3672.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer (IE). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will access an object that has not been correctly initialized or has been deleted and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Ryan Smith of Verisign IDefense Labs, team509 via iDefense, Sam Thomas of eshu.co.uk via TippingPoint, and anonymous researchers via TippingPoint reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3672.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3673.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Memory Access Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3673.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer (IE). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will access an object that has not been correctly initialized or has been deleted and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Ryan Smith of Verisign IDefense Labs, team509 via iDefense, Sam Thomas of eshu.co.uk via TippingPoint, and anonymous researchers via TippingPoint reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3673.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3674.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Memory Access Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3674.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer (IE). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will access an object that has not been correctly initialized or has been deleted and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Ryan Smith of Verisign IDefense Labs, team509 via iDefense, Sam Thomas of eshu.co.uk via TippingPoint, and anonymous researchers via TippingPoint reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3674.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3676.title: Windows Kernel Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-3676.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Windows Kernel. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to enter an infinite loop and the system to become unavailable.The vendor was notified on November 8, 2009.Laurent Gaffie reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3676.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2009-3677.title: Microsoft Internet Authentication Service Bugs Let Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code or Gain Privileges of the Target User
CVE-2009-3677.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Authentication Service. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote authenticated user can privileges of the target user.A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted Protected Extensible Authentication Protocol (PEAP) authentication requests to trigger a memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-2505]. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted Microsoft Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol version 2 (MS-CHAP v2) authentication request to obtain access to network resources with the privilege of a target user [CVE-2009-3677].
CVE-2009-3677.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote authenticated user can gain access privileges of the target user.

CVE-2009-3691.title: IBM Informix Client SDK Integer Overflow in Processing '.nfx' Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3691.body: A vulnerability was reported in Informix. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.nfx' file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow in setnet32 and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The original advisory and demonstration exploit code are available at:http://retrogod.altervista.org/9sg_ibm_setnet32.htmlNine:Situations:Group::bruiser reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3691.extra: A remote user can create a '.nfx' file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3699.title: IBM AIX Buffer Overflow in 'rpc.cmsd' Lets Remote Users Obtain Root Privileges
CVE-2009-3699.body: A vulnerability was reported in the IBM AIX calendar daemon. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the calendar daemon ('rpc.cmsd') to trigger a buffer overflow in the calendar daemon library ('libcsa.a') and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with root privileges.Rodrigo Rubira Branco and iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3699.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.

CVE-2009-3700.title: squidGuard Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Bypass URL Filtering
CVE-2009-3700.body: A vulnerability was reported in squidGuard. A remote user can bypass the URL filtering mechanism. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted request to trigger a buffer overflow and cause squidGuard to enter emergency mode (where no requests are filtered).A remote user can also send a specially crafted request to cause the target service instance to freeze. This can be repeated to cause denial of service conditions.Matthieu Bouthors reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3700.extra: A remote user can bypass the URL filtering mechanism.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2009-3701.title: Horde Application Framework Input Validation Flaw in Administrator Scripts Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-3701.body: A vulnerability was reported in Horde Application Framework. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The administrator interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Horde Application Framework software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Users of Firefox browsers are affected.Juan Galiana Lara and Daniel Fernandez Bleda from Internet Security Auditors reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3701.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Horde Application Framework software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-3705.title: Achievo Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting, SQL Injection, and Include File Attacks
CVE-2009-3705.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Achievo. A remote user can include and execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted URL to cause the target system to include and execute arbitrary PHP code from a remote location. The PHP code, including operating system commands, will run with the privileges of the target web service.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2009-2733]. The code will originate from the site running the Achievo software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user. Ryan Dewhurst reported this vulnerability.The 'title' variable in the scheduler module is affected. The atksearch[contractnumber], atksearch_AE_customer[customer], and atksearchmode[contracttype] variables in the 'Organisation Contracts' administration page are affected.A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2009-2734]. The 'user_id' parameter in 'dispatch.php' is affected. Ryan Dewhurst reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3705.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary PHP code and operating system commands on the target system with the privileges of the target web service.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Achievo software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2009-3727.title: Asterisk Discloses Valid Usersnames to Remote Users in Response to Specially Crafted REGISTER Messages
CVE-2009-3727.body: A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted REGISTER message twice to determine if the specified username exists on the target system.The vendor was notified on October 26, 2009.Patrik Karlsson reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3727.extra: A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system.

CVE-2009-3731.title: CA SiteMinder Input Validation Flaw in WebWorks Help Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2009-3731.body: A vulnerability was reported in CA SiteMinder. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The WebWorks Help component does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the CA SiteMinder software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Daniel Grzelak and Alex Kouzemtchenko of stratsec (www.stratsec.net) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3731.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the CA SiteMinder software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2009-3733.title: VMware Server Directory Traversal Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Arbitrary Files
CVE-2009-3733.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware Server. A remote user can view files on the target host system.A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to the target host system to view arbitrary files on the target host system.Justin Morehouse and Jason Kratzer independently reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3733.extra: A remote user can view files on the target system.

CVE-2009-3733.title: VMware ESX/ESXi Directory Traversal Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Arbitrary Files
CVE-2009-3733.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESX/ESXi Server. A remote user can view files on the target system.A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to the target host system to view arbitrary files on target host system.On ESX Server, the remote user must be able to access the Service Console network to exploit this flaw.Justin Morehouse and Jason Kratzer independently reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3733.extra: A remote user can view files on the target system.

CVE-2009-3743.title: Ghostscript TrueType Integer Overflow in Ins_MINDEX() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3743.body: A vulnerability was reported in Ghostscript. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted font file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will trigger an off-by-one integer overflow in the Ins_MINDEX() function in 'libgs.so.8' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user or application.The vendor was notified on October 19, 2009.Jonathan Brossard from Toucan System reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3743.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2009-3757.title: Citrix XenCenterWeb Multiple Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting, SQL Injection, and Remote Command Execution Attacks
CVE-2009-3757.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Citrix XenCenterWeb. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can inject SQL commands.A remote user can invoke the '/var/www/config/writeconfig.php' script (or cause a target user to invoke the script) to write arbitrary data to '/usr/local/lib/php/include/config.ini.php' and then access the console script to cause the data to be executed. The code will be executed with the privileges of the target web service.Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Citrix XenCenterWeb software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The username parameter in 'edituser.php' is affected. The 'location', 'vmname', and 'sessionid' parameters in 'console.php' are affected.Other parameters and scripts are affected.The 'login.php' script does not properly validate user-supplied input in the 'username' parameter. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:https://[target]/login.php?username=user' UNION SELECT if(user() LIKE 'root@%', benchmark(1000000,sha1('test')), 'false')/*The vendor was notified on June 1, 2009.Alberto Trivero and Claudio Criscione of Secure Network reported these vulnerabilities.The original advisory is available at:http://securenetwork.it/ricerca/advisory/download/SN-2009-01.txt[Editor's note: The vendor has clarified that the affected software is sample code that was included in the XenServer Resource Kit. The code is no longer available and is not supported.]
CVE-2009-3757.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Citrix XenCenterWeb software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2009-3793.title: Adobe Flash Player Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitary Code, Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks, and Deny Service
CVE-2009-3793.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Various memory corruption, buffer overflows, use-after-free memory access, pointer errors, indexing errors, and memory exhaustion flaws permit arbitrary code execution [CVE-2009-3793, CVE-2010-2160, CVE-2010-2161, CVE-2010-2162, CVE-2010-2163, CVE-2010-2164, CVE-2010-2165, CVE-2010-2166, CVE-2010-2167, CVE-2010-2169, CVE-2010-2170, CVE-2010-2171, CVE-2010-2173, CVE-2010-2174, CVE-2010-2175, CVE-2010-2176, CVE-2010-2177, CVE-2010-2178, CVE-2010-2180, CVE-2010-2181, CVE-2010-2182, CVE-2010-2183, CVE-2010-2184, CVE-2010-2185, CVE-2010-2187, CVE-2010-2188].A denial of service flaw may be able to be leveraged to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2010-2186].A memory corruption flaw on VMware systems with VMware Tools enabled can allow code execution [CVE-2010-2189].A denial of service flaw exists [CVE-2008-4546].A URL parsing error can permit cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2010-2179], affecting Firefox and Chrome browsers.Flash Player 9 on some UNIX platforms allows denial of service conditions [CVE-2010-2172].Will Dormann of CERT, Ralph Loader of Innaworks Development Limited, an anonymous researcher (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative), Dionysus Blazakis (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative), an anonymous researcher (via iDefense's Vulnerability Contributor Program), Damian Put (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative), Megumi Yanagishita of Palo Alto Networks Inc., Bing Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs, Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Vulnerability Research Team, Manuel Caballero and Microsoft Vulnerability Research (MSVR), Tielei Wang from ICST-ERCIS (Engineering Research Center of Info Security, Institute of Computer Science & Technology, Peking University/China), Red Hat Security Response Team, Bo Qu of Palo Alto Networks, Ezio Anselmo Mazarim Fernandes, Haifei Li of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs, and Tavis Ormandy of the Google Security Team reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3793.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2009-3793.title: Adobe AIR Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitary Code, Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks, and Deny Service

A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Various memory corruption, buffer overflows, use-after-free memory access, pointer errors, indexing errors, and memory exhaustion flaws permit arbitrary code execution [CVE-2009-3793, CVE-2010-2160, CVE-2010-2161, CVE-2010-2162, CVE-2010-2163, CVE-2010-2164, CVE-2010-2165, CVE-2010-2166, CVE-2010-2167, CVE-2010-2169, CVE-2010-2170, CVE-2010-2171, CVE-2010-2173, CVE-2010-2174, CVE-2010-2175, CVE-2010-2176, CVE-2010-2177, CVE-2010-2178, CVE-2010-2180, CVE-2010-2181, CVE-2010-2182, CVE-2010-2183, CVE-2010-2184, CVE-2010-2185, CVE-2010-2187, CVE-2010-2188].A denial of service flaw may be able to be leveraged to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2010-2186].A memory corruption flaw on VMware systems with VMware Tools enabled can allow code execution [CVE-2010-2189].A denial of service flaw exists [CVE-2008-4546].A URL parsing error can permit cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2010-2179], affecting Firefox and Chrome browsers.Will Dormann of CERT, Ralph Loader of Innaworks Development Limited, an anonymous researcher (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative), Dionysus Blazakis (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative), an anonymous researcher (via iDefense's Vulnerability Contributor Program), Damian Put (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative), Megumi Yanagishita of Palo Alto Networks Inc., Bing Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs, Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Vulnerability Research Team, Manuel Caballero and Microsoft Vulnerability Research (MSVR), Tielei Wang from ICST-ERCIS (Engineering Research Center of Info Security, Institute of Computer Science & Technology, Peking University/China), Red Hat Security Response Team, Bo Qu of Palo Alto Networks, Ezio Anselmo Mazarim Fernandes, Haifei Li of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs, and Tavis Ormandy of the Google Security Team reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3793.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2009-3794.title: Adobe Flash Player Memory Corruption Errors Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3794.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can create a specially crafted JPEG file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-3794]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create Flash content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-3796, CVE-2009-3797, CVE-2009-3798, CVE-2009-3799, and CVE-2009-3800].A remote user can access file names on target systems running Windows by exploiting the Flash Player ActiveX control [CVE-2009-3951].Flash Professional CS3 and CS4 are also affected.Jim Cheng of EffectiveUI, Bing Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs, an anonymous researcher via TippingPoint, Damian Put via TippingPoint, Will Dormann of CERT, and Manuel Caballero and Microsoft Vulnerability Research (MSVR) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3794.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2009-3794.title: Adobe AIR Memory Corruption Errors Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code

A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted JPEG file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-3794]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create Flash content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-3796, CVE-2009-3797, CVE-2009-3798, CVE-2009-3799, and CVE-2009-3800].Jim Cheng of EffectiveUI, Bing Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs, an anonymous researcher via TippingPoint, Damian Put via TippingPoint, and Will Dormann of CERT reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3794.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3796.title: Adobe Flash Player Memory Corruption Errors Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3796.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can create a specially crafted JPEG file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-3794]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create Flash content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-3796, CVE-2009-3797, CVE-2009-3798, CVE-2009-3799, and CVE-2009-3800].A remote user can access file names on target systems running Windows by exploiting the Flash Player ActiveX control [CVE-2009-3951].Flash Professional CS3 and CS4 are also affected.Jim Cheng of EffectiveUI, Bing Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs, an anonymous researcher via TippingPoint, Damian Put via TippingPoint, Will Dormann of CERT, and Manuel Caballero and Microsoft Vulnerability Research (MSVR) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3796.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2009-3826.title: squidGuard Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Bypass URL Filtering
CVE-2009-3826.body: A vulnerability was reported in squidGuard. A remote user can bypass the URL filtering mechanism. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted request to trigger a buffer overflow and cause squidGuard to enter emergency mode (where no requests are filtered).A remote user can also send a specially crafted request to cause the target service instance to freeze. This can be repeated to cause denial of service conditions.Matthieu Bouthors reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3826.extra: A remote user can bypass the URL filtering mechanism.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2009-3838.title: Pegasus Mail ERR POP Command Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2009-3838.body: A vulnerability was reported in Pegasus Mail. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted POP ERR command data to TCP port 110 on the target server to trigger a buffer overflow and cause the target service to crash.Francis Provencher (Protek Research Lab's) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3838.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2009-3843.title: HP Operations Manager Hidden Account Lets Remote Users Access the System
CVE-2009-3843.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP Operations Manager. A remote user can access the target system.The Tomact users XML file contains a hidden account. A remote user can access the 'org.apache.catalina.manager.HTMLManagerServlet' class via this account to upload a file containing arbitrary code to the '/manager/html/upload' directory and then execute the code with System privileges.Windows-based systems are affected.The vendor was notified on November 9, 2009.Stephen Fewer of Harmony Security reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.
CVE-2009-3843.extra: A remote user can access the target system.

CVE-2009-3844.title: HP OpenView Data Protector Application Recovery Manager MSG_PROTOCOL Stack Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3844.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP OpenView Data Protector Application Recovery Manager. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted MSG_PROTOCOL (0x010b) message to the target OmniInet process on TCP port 5555 to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code.The vendor was notified on June 25, 2009.The original advisory is available at:http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-09-091/Stephen Fewer of Harmony Security reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.[Editor's note: The vendor's advisory indicates that this is only a denial of service vulnerability.]
CVE-2009-3844.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2009-3853.title: IBM Tivoli Storage Manager Client Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3853.body: Three vulnerabilities were reported in IBM Tivoli Storage Manager. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can access files on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in the client acceptor daemon (CAD) scheduler and execute arbitrary code on the target client system [CVE-2008-4826]. Non-Macintosh and non-Express clients are only affected if the MANAGEDSERVICES option is set to SCHEDULE. Dyon Balding of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in the traditional client scheduler and execute arbitrary code on the target client system.When the MAILPROG option is enabled, a remote user can gain access to files on the target UNIX or Linux-based systems.
CVE-2009-3853.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can access and modify files on the target system.

CVE-2009-3854.title: IBM Tivoli Storage Manager Client Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3854.body: Three vulnerabilities were reported in IBM Tivoli Storage Manager. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can access files on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in the client acceptor daemon (CAD) scheduler and execute arbitrary code on the target client system [CVE-2008-4826]. Non-Macintosh and non-Express clients are only affected if the MANAGEDSERVICES option is set to SCHEDULE. Dyon Balding of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in the traditional client scheduler and execute arbitrary code on the target client system.When the MAILPROG option is enabled, a remote user can gain access to files on the target UNIX or Linux-based systems.
CVE-2009-3854.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can access and modify files on the target system.

CVE-2009-3859.title: Retina WiFi Security Scanner Buffer Overflow in Parsing '.rws' Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3859.body: A vulnerability was reported in Retina WiFi Security Scanner. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.rws' file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on May 16, 2009.The original advisory is available at:http://liquidworm.blogspot.com/2009/07/retina-wifi-security-scanner-10-rws.htmlGjoko 'LiquidWorm' Krstic reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3859.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3861.title: SafeNet SoftRemote Buffer Overflow in Processing Policy Files May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2009-3861.body: A vulnerability was reported in SafeNet SoftRemote. A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user with the ability to set specially crafted 'TREENAME' or 'GROUPNAME' values in the spd files can trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code. The code will run with the privileges of the SoftRemote client.Brett Gervasoni from SOS Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2009-3861.extra: A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2009-3865.title: Sun Java Runtime Environment Deployment Toolkit Plugin Launch Method Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2009-3865.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Sun Java Runtime Environment Deployment Toolkit. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit a flaw in the launch method to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An anonymous reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2009-3865.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2009-3867.title: Sun Java Runtime Environment Buffer Overflows in Processing Audio and Image Files Lets Remote Users Access Files and Gain Privileges on the Target System
CVE-2009-3867.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sun Java Runtime Environment (JRE). A remote user can access files on the target user's system. A remote user can cause arbitrary applications on the target user's system to be executed.A remote user can create a specially crafted applet or Java Web Start application that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer or integer overflow in the processing of audio and image files to gain access to files on the target system or execute arbitrary applications residing on the target system.Peter Vreugdenhil (via TippingPoint), regenrecht (via iDefense and TippingPoint), and anonymous researchers (via iDefense and TippingPoint) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2009-3867.extra: A remote user can create a Java applet or Java Web Start application that, when loaded by the target user, will access files or execute arbitrary applications on the target user's system.
